text: Make your own special pizza just the way I Want it.  Choose peppeeoni, feta, pineapple, olives, bacon.  Tasted fantastic together. Can add so much more.  They are quick preparing but it's got to melt together.  Worth the wait.

Yummy pizza. Friendly cashiers what else could a guy ask for?

Just reopened after being closed for a few days. 

Store is cleaner and pizza just as amazing. I will be back again soon!!

Really good! Quality pizza and super creative.  I usually don't write reviews but this place definitely deserves it (: 
Come back here if you want a quick delicious bite!

Excellent place to eat at the MGM.  For 12 bucks you can get a pizza with as many topping you want.  So good.  If you want a beer or beers to go with the pizza all you have to do is walk across the concoarse and get yall some.  Also next door is a new orleans daquiri place is that is what yall are looking for with ur pizza.

Great place to stop for pizza.  I noticed when someone asked for gluten free they were VERY careful about clarifying that they do NOT operate a gluten free part of the kitchen and contamination could occur, so no celiacs need apply.  I liked that they took this seriously (even though I'm not gluten free myself) since there are serious health consequences for celiacs.  

I got the #2 + green peppers.  Just a basic thin crust pepperoni with red sauce and sausage.  Really good pizza oven that's set up correctly.  Nice charred crust, just how I like it.  Be careful when eating or else you won't be able to taste it long (600 degrees F oven).  Atmosphere and table cleaning needs a little work, but it's not bad at all.

I came here a Thursday night on the 8th of May, and this is hands down, got to be the BEST $12 I've spend for a pizza! For my first time there, the build your own pizza is amazingly delicious! I devoured it right after I got it, lol. 

The workers there are friendly and very helpful on explaining how to built your own pizza and what to put on it. 

I think I found my to go place for pizza whenever I'm in Vegas now!

Located in the lower level of MGM (you have to take escalators to the lower level and  you'll see it on the right), Project Pie is a great place to have a custom made pizza that's quick and affordable. And yes, they are open late.

You can choose from one of their already pre-set pizza options or make your own with your toppings of choice. The pizza is pretty good for the price, it's a great quick fix. 

Once you order, you pay at the counter. Our pizzas took around 15-20 minutes.
Best pizza I've found in Vegas!  Worth stopping by for sure, you won't be disappointed.

Ate here twice during our stay at MGM Grand because it was that good! Chose from their signature pizzas or build your own.  Great pizzas with fresh ingredients and the folks behind the counter were especially friendly and helpful in my genuine way.  The only reason I give it a four instead of a five is that we had to wipe down our own tables both times we ate there.
Awesome service and great food! The staff was very friendly and being here felt like I've been coming for years.  I would definitely recommend it to anyone in the mgm Grand or if your visiting Vegas.

Excellent pizza! Fast service and great people who work there! Me and my husband hadn't been to project pie before and they helped us decide what we would like best! And it was like 2 minutes and our pizza was hot out of their oven! We will definitely be back.

Hands down the best pizza I have ever in my life had the pleasure of eating. Excellent topping choices, crust is amazing and crisply. Not so greasy, amazing. 
The staff was great, they even gave me suggestions when I wasn't sure exactly what I wanted. Pizza came out in a reasonable amount of time. The bathrooms were very clean which is important since I have a small child who has to pee in every new place we visit. 

Awesome little place. I will most definitely be coming back or having them come to me.

FORGET ABOUT ANY NEGATIVE COMMENTS ABOUT PROJECT PIE!!!! (forgive any misspelled names) but Ally, Jess, and Devin were really cool! They were very friendly and the pies were AMAZING!!!!! (and if you want a beer, grab one across the way) we WILL BE BACK and I'd recommend this place to anyone hungry for a good meal! thanks guys! you made our visit worth it!!

Ate here today- staff was friendly, place was clean, food was excellent. They don't charge for extra toppings and even ask if you want extra this or that and if you want to switch something out.  I had the number three and my husband had the number 7.  Both were very good, thin crust pizzas.  I had side caesar kale salad and that was also very light and tasty.  Great little place in the basement or 'underground' of MGM.

The pizza cost between $12. It was thin crust, made to order, and you can put any toppings or sauce you want on it. It took about 5-10mins for the pizza. Originally I had order one to split with my bf, but we order an extra one because one wasn't enough between the two of us.

Actually one of the best pizza places yet. Love the crisp and thinness of the pizza and the fact that we can choose our own topping. My fav is #7 pizza and would be even better if we add some sauce. The house/mixed (sry i forgot name) salad is delicious. All in all i strongly recommend u try it out.
Great pizza in a odd place. Great diversion from mall court food and high-end eateries.
First off excellent customer service, good pizza Super Fast. I would've liked more cheese but still excellent pizza.
This place by far has the best pizza I have ever had. So fresh. Ingredients are chosen by yourself what more can you ask for? If your staying in mgm stop by and get a pizza.
Mmmmmmm excellent pizza with great toppings at MGM grand. Nice crispy thin crust has turned me into a pizza lover!!!!

OMG...this has got to be the best pizza I've ever had! Located in the underground at the MGM, you get to build your own pizzas or pick from the comobs that they've already created. It's pretty amazing. The people working there are so friendly (they recognized us when we showed up for pizza the very next day!) and seem to really enjoy what they do. They've got a great setup so I wish them the best. Pizza was AWESOME! We need one in Philly!

Delicious ! Cheap ! Hot ! Fresh ! Friendly staff ! Yummmmm.
We want here 3 times in 10 days and my parents 4 times. Best pizza we've had. Love being able to choose our own ingredients. The bases were thin but crispy and delicious
Hands down one of the best pizzas I have ever had. #3 with pesto and veggies.. Holy cow! Great service too.

What a simple and fun concept. You watch them make your pizza in front of you, put whatever you want on it, and 2 minutes later, it's in and out of the wood-fired oven. 

There isn't enough seating in this small Underground location. 

Project Pie could be a nationwide chain one day.
Great thin crust, I had a white pie. I didn't want the Gorgonzola and they asked if I wanted to substitute something else. Super friendly people.

Gotta give props where props are do. So staff : props! Pizza : props location : props

Staff: Asia, Chloe, Devon PROPS

Great, quick  pizza. I just can't say how we loved the food and the service is amazing, especially Devon who let us order even though we arrived just seconds before they closed. We were starving after just arriving in Vegas and this pizza was perfect. Thanks for starting my wife's birthday with a smile!

BEST strip pizza hands down.  The flavor of the pepperoni was spot on.  roasted red bell peppers and crust that's TO DIE FOR!  Check it out in the MGM GRAND section called, THE UNDERGROUND (we asked a few employees and some of them had never heard of it...it wasn't crowded, but there was a steady stream of people ordering (at the counter) and eating DELISH 'ZAH!  Perfect for right after you win at roulette!  :  )
Great fresh food, reasonable price and good service.  We had the mixed salad with walnut, blue cheese, cranberry with raspberry vinegarette.

The pizza was delicious - I got mine with red sauce, chicken, caramelized onions, mushrooms and garlic.  Thin crust was great.  The music was good.  It is like eating in a food court, though, not a restaurant - so just be aware of the ambiance - that's the only reason I knocked off a star.  If you don't care about that, great food, beer from across the way, very friendly staff make this a five.

Awesome pizza! I don't think I have ever had a better crust. At $12 a pizza this place can't be beat for a place to grab a bite on the strip. 
We ordered the BBQ chicken pizza, the carmelized onion with prosciutto pizza, and the artichoke, tomato, and Gorgonzola cheese pizza. They were all so yummy. There were three if us eating and each of us loved our pizza choice. I definitely recommend this place!
This place has never let me down!!!  Fast service and great pies!  Any time I am at MGM I always make a stop here.  You can't go wrong because you build your own pizza.

Simply amazing. An extensive variety of different style pizzas as well as the option to customize your own with choice of toppings. I think the pizza sizes are just right. One size only. But its not too big and not too small. Very fresh. The staff there are super friendly and enjoy making conversation with you, which is rare nowadays. Laidback atmosphere with a modern touch in design that is showcased through the wall art as well as seating design.

I love Project Pie !!! I eat here at least once a month! 
I love the fact that they customize your pie, right in front of you ! The employees are fun, out-going, and great pizza makers ! Plus start to finish the pizza only takes 5 minutes. ( Don't quote me on that :) - but seriously, it's around 3-5 mins.) 
Plus, for the size of the whole pizza you get - you cant beat the price- especially for a casino food establishment !

This Project rightfully earned their A+ in my books! Kind of disappointed in myself for not trying this establishment in San Diego where I live and where Project Pie originated but hey, I'm glad I made my way here.

Project Pie's crust is thin but extremely soft; I love it. I have never been to pieology before but I am sure there are some structural parallels between the two in terms of having the option to build your own pizza from the crust up and what not. However, I'd put money on Project Pies' creations because I'm sure their ingredients are quality and their thin fluffy crust will win your heart over. 

Now of course I like to be creative/use my imagination and what not but when places offer signature combinations, I like to try them before I start moving furniture around. Between me and a buddy of mine, we ordered a #2 (Pepp, italian sausage, meatballs, red sauce garlic) and #5 (Ricotta, Mozzarella, the white pizza etc...) and boy were they appetizing. We both wanted to try another one actually but knew we had to preserve our appetite for the other famous food Las Vegas had to offer. I really enjoyed the #5 white pizza. I feel the cheeses really brought out the flavor in the crust and you can never go wrong with basil. The #2 was a solid pizza on it's own but got boring well maybe out shined in this case by the #7 lol. I would order the #2 again as long as I ordered another pie to go along with it. 

I believe you can split a single pie down the middle so don't be afraid to ask the pizza makers for 2 signature combinations on one pizza.

GREAT service. Team members are awesome and make an effort to entertain you. We liked our pizza, but built our own and made it too salty - that's our fault. Otherwise the price and the quality ingredients were on point and we would definitely visit again.

My boyfriend and I come to your place almost daily. ..it's the best pizza in Vegas.  All of the workers there are friendly and professional. .would recommend this place to everyone that visits and lives in Vegas...
10 stars instead of 5

Var här med familjen. Rest fr LA och var trötta. Bra alternativ för snabbmat. Rekommenderar att göra egen pizza. Jag valde dock kycklingpizza på menyn som var god. Övriga familjen gjorde egna. Tunn krispig botten. Fri påfyllning på läsk.

Celiac/Gluten Free Review: 
After reading about really great gluten-free pizza done with care, a friend and I tried Project Pie for dinner. It wasn't busy by the time we got there and so I could ask a lot of questions. One review I had read said that the staff takes care to use different utensils AND that they put the gluten-free crust in a separate metal pan before putting in their oven. 

I didn't find any of this to be true on my visit. The staff did robotically say "we are a gluten-filled environment and can't guarantee cross-contamination," but they honestly seemed to have no idea about what food allergies were as they used the same oil brushes and did not cook my pizza in a dedicated pan.

Because we had just gotten off the plane and were starving, I didn't have any other dinner options at the time. I was mildly sick after eating, but no extreme reactions. The pizza I had was good (hence the two stars) and the prices fair, but the lack of staff training and nonchalance is a major downside and reflects my rating.

Project Pie is NOT safe for Celiacs as they seemed to have changed their policies on food handling from the reviews that I've read online. If you have extreme sensitivities and intolerances, it would be best to go elsewhere for pizza.

Found this place strictly through the glowing Yelp reviews.  It really is a hidden gem as it is in the basement of the MGM Grand. Very tasty, thin crust, build it to your own specifications for one price and the pizzas are cooked amazingly fast although built from scratch. They were done almost by the time we sat down at the table after placing our order.  The person at the register said it's because they partially cook their crusts ahead of time.  Highly recommend for a quick, no-frills, high quality pie.

Been to 3 or 4 other buid your own pizza types of places. Comparatively, I would say Project Pie has less toppings options. However, they do have prosciutto, which I haven't seen at any other build your own pizza place. 

I chose one of the pre-designed pizzas which had prosciutto and caramelized onions. Not sure how I felt about the salty/sweet contrast, but the pizza itself, crust and all, was good.

$12 is a great price. The pizza was worth more.

I visited as a tourist, but this place is not a tourist trap.  This place has legit pizza.

Delicious pizza made as you order. I love really crispy and baked pizza and their fire oven does it perfectly.  One pizza can fill one person. And as a local it's nice not having to go all the way in the casino get here.

Absolutely delicious! We went at around 1:30 and it was completely empty. It's not necessarily HARD to find, but you wouldn't be able to see it from the main hotel/strip. It's underground at the MGM, and once you get there it's pretty quiet - a nice little escape from the hustle and bustle. 

The food was so good. We got the #3 pizza and 2 drinks. Total was about $20. Not too shabby for Vegas! As I said before: so. good. 

We will definitely be returning on our next trip!

Twelve bucks for whatever topping as much u like!!  The fire brick oven makes the crust SUPA ono!!  We had the purcuitto ham and all kind veggies for toppings.  We also had the large ceasers salad too.  Xlent place to have pizza!  We will go again soon.
Think Chipotle for pizza- great selection of toppings, good flavors. Excellent bang for your buck! Recommend sharing a pie for 2, unlimited toppings are free.

One of the best pizzas I have ever tasted. I selected the build your own pizza which allows you to completely customize your own pie. Imagine your order experience at a subway, that is basically what you can expect at Project Pie. They have a very good variety of cheese, meats, and toppings such as ricotta, mozzarella, goat cheese, meat balls, Canadian bacon, prosciutto, fresh garlic, artichokes, mushrooms, spinach, pineapple, etc. The ingredients are of very good quality which made the pizza have an incredible flavor. The staff was friendly, ambiance felt very lively and nice, and the price for the pie was highly affordable ($12 for the fully customized pie) I will definitely be returning next time I am in Vegas.

Best pizza I've had in the US, and I live in NYC. Perfect place to come for a quick amazing, fresh pizza without having to deal with anyone trying to constantly up sell you. 
I recommend making your own because you can add every single topping for the same $12 price!
Had to check this place out because of the amazing smell! Great place to eat in the MGM Grand with out breaking the bank!

So I'm at the MGM after a fight and I'm hungry
I know what your thinking... Joel Robuchon... J/K
Ok Joel's out but I'm also not hitting the food court

The MISSION is good food at a good price
Project Pie is where these 2 things intersect 
It's not the best pizza in Vegas but it's really good

I guess I like the Project (concept) a little more then the pie
The Project is a "Subway" style of ordering (build your own pizza)
If your pizza isn't good it's on you because you stink at building your own pie 
The key here is it's all fresh ingredients,made to order,personal size pies

I'm not saying you are going to do a handstand or write home about this place 
But you might say to yourself "if I ever have to do a project I hope it's pie"

$12 for a 12 inch BUILD YOUR OWN PIE or you can have one of their signature pie's. THIN CRUST! This pizza is the best pizza place in Las Vegas. I'm not a pizza fan unless it's N.Y. pizza. Project Pie has made me a pizza fan again. Also the staff is extremely friendly. I definitely will be back. Located in the MGM GRAND.

This place is great as a last minute stop before heading back to your room to get ready to go out. Wish they were open later because I would love it as an after club snack but either way worth it. You get to design and create your own pizza with any and all toppings for $12. Yes a little pricey in my opinion but your in Vegas. They have awesome quotes all over the walls and are located underground at the MGM. Unfortunately not much of a view but nicely hidden off the beaten path

What more can I say than yum!!!! My fiancé and I decided to check Project Pie out because of the reviews and we are allowed 1 cheat meal a week ( training for a comp) and we're looking for the best pizza in Vegas.  We found it.  So very good.  I highly recommend this place.  The pizza was amazing, Very fresh toppings, friendly staff, and we also got half off because we were military.  

I highly recommend Project Pie,  we are looking forward to going back!!!!

This place is amazing. I ordered a Build Your Own with marinara sauce and mozzarella and with all the vegetables except jalapeño and the sweet ones like pineapple and cranberries. With all that it ended to be about $12. More details to come.
Great pizza, great service and respect for strip hotel employees! Show your work ID!!!

Four of us made our own pizzas.  I walked next door to pick up a drink and by the time I got back, the of the pizzas were already done!

The pizza was great and to top it off, we got a complimentary cinnamon and sugar dessert pie.  Soo good, my friends had to stop me from eating all of it.

To me, this is the best build your own pizza spot in Las Vegas. 

It's real, uncooked pizza dough (unlike in Downtown Summerlin). You then can choose any toppings you want, and they have plenty of variety. 

The flash cooking doesn't burn the bottom like other places. The dough still comes out soft and fluffy. The toppings also don't all slide off (like at 800 degrees). 

As far as eating fairly inexpensively, this is the place to go on the Strip. It's delicious pizza for only $12. The only place that can MAYBE beat it is Secret Pizza. 

I also like that this is easy to get to for locals. All you have to do is park at MGM, and it's right in that entrance.

Another place I would have never found without yelp! Reminds me of subway but I would way rather eat here! pick whatever toppings you want and volia! Tasty pizza!!  Price is reasonable and doesn't take very long to cook the pizza.  staff was friendly.  Not easy to find if you don't know where you going.  take a hard right before the check in counter and go into the basement of the mgm.  keep walking and you cant miss it.
Super fast super fresh personal pies made to order right in front of your eyes. Project Pie is the Chipolte of Pizza chains. Most chain pizza is hideous. This is not.

I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. I found Project Pie to be A-OK but definitely not mind blowing. The crust is very thin -- a bit too thin for my personal liking. I got the white pizza with garlic, basil + ricotta cheese and it was pretty good but again nothing that blew my socks off. 

I personally enjoyed 800 degrees near Monte Carlo a lot more
I got the #6 and added mushrooms, my husband got a meat and cheese creation.  We both really enjoyed them.  The crust was good, not floppy, not crunchy.

This is a great option when you're tired of the pricey food places in the hotels.. Make your way to the underground at MGM and build a tasty treat. If you want a cold beer with your pizza, stop next door at Fat Tuesdays and bring it with you. This isn't a formal sit down place for a group. It's a build your own personal size pizza.

Enjoy!

Not a bad idea, but the execution was lacking.  For a place like this to work, the staff should be more enthusiastic in helping the customer understand the process and create their pie.  In this case, it seemed like they were discouraging creativity, impatient with customers as they made their orders.  The pizza was ok, but I won't go back because of the service.

We had been wanting pizza but didn't want to do an overpriced eatery at a casino.  After checking the reviews on Yelp we decided to stop by on our way out of town.  The staff was extremely nice and explained the process.  It's very similar to Chipotle where you start with a blank canvas and they build it from there.  They have 7 types of specialty pizza to choose from or you can build your own with as many toppings as you want for only $12.  The location isn't the best, but its worth the trek if you want cheap, tasty pizza!

Las Vegas native here and I didn't even know about this place!! Fantastic pizza!  Hands down the best pizza in town!  The peanut butter and Nutella pie is to die for. I will definitely be back very soon!

Very good gluten free pizza, which is always a nice option to have. More importantly, if you tell them you have an allergy they will use separate tools, and clean out the oven for you. They are also able to provide allergen information regarding the crust, great if you have multiple food allergies like myself. I have eaten here twice with no problems - a great place for food allergies! Thank you Project Pie!

Locals eat here. Simple, Subway-type ordering. Get anything you want on your pizza. Crust is crisp and light. Service is friendly. 

Escape the smoke and high prices at the rest of MGM Grand. Have a relatively quiet, delicious, reasonably-priced meal here instead!
Best pizza place ever!  Like Port of Subs, but for your pizza!  $12.97 for a large pizza with UNLIMITED toppings!  Must visit this place!
Excellent Pizza and perfectly cooked. The topping options are great and the staff is very friendly. Just the right amount of food and away from the loud slots and smoking rooms.

This place got good reviews so my boyfriend and I decided to check it out, it was delish! We were looking for a small lunch just enough to hold us over until our dinner. This place was perfect. You create your own pizza and carry on. Decent price as well .

Ok, I'm going against the opinions of the majority. I was not impressed with this place. 
Dropped in yesterday while vacationing in Vegas. The only bright spot for me was the extremely polite and friendly employees who waited on me. The employees, a man and a lady, get 5 stars.
The food gets 2 stars. Did it satisfy my hunger? Yeah, because I was hungry. If it was in my budget, then I would have purchased something else from somewhere else and gave the pizza away. But I'm not one to waste money.
The pizza didn't taste fresh. Starting with the crust, everything tasted frozen and prepackaged.
I've been to other places with the same concept. Not only does this place rank low in quality and taste, it's at least $4 more expensive.

Now this place is located in the basement of the MGM grand casino, so as soon as you enter here, it's very quiet and nice. Keeping up with the trend of making your own food, they allow you to make any modifications to their menu and suggest some good things as well. All the ingredients are fresh and the pizza is the best thin crust I have had outside new york city. 

The cook changed his gloves when he found out, we are vegetarians. I would not recommend this place to gluten sensitive people because of the cross contamination. Pizza pie to delicious and both of us were very happy and satisfied at the end. Price is reasonable for Las Vegas. They have nice quotes on the wall to keep you busy while your pizza is being cooked. 

A strong recommendation for anyone looking for a nice pizza in the basement of all the hustle and bustle.

This was our favorite stumbled-upon find, while searching for the monorail (useless useless creature) at 12:30AM. 

Unlimited toppings on a 12" pie for $12? Score! Then when I found out we could have half-half toppings, I melted into a choices-galore hot mess. I'm glad my SO was craving a vanilla milkshake ($4) that night. They made it to order (so it actually took a little longer than our pizza), and was huge + oh so fresh! I think this usurps In-N-Out's milkshake as my #1 now.

The decor is vintage industrial, and the ingredients are sustainable. Ahh, I wish they would open a location in the Bay Area!

great friendly service, large cheese pizza 10 bucks.  Brushed with an oil sprinkled with cheese and cooked.  Crust was absolutely perfect.  Cheese was a bit sparse but once cooked covered the pie.  Sauce was good but nothing to write home to mom about.  You start adding toppings and your will have a 20 pizza so be careful.
Great pizza. Cooked fast. Prepared how you want. No complaints and will definitely go back next time I am in town.
really good thin crust pizza. don't overdo the toppings

This place is sooo good! $12 for a pizza and it was worth every penny. The place was packed but it was worth the wait. The staff was very friendly to all of us. Go check it out if you are craving pizza.

Had the salad pie. It was delicious. Light and tasty, with only a few ingredients. One star taken away due to the slow service. There weren't many people in the place and it took a bit too long for our food to come out. Nice little quick spot though If you are in the MGM and don't want to break the bank.

This place is quite a secret in the MGM Grand casino. It is not on the same floor as all of the "fancier" restaurants as it is in the basement/lower level next to the comedy club. If they could move this place up to the main floor, there would be lines of people waiting. The pizza is excellent and has a really good crust. I went twice during my brief stay there. I had the chicken, yellow and red peppers, with pesto sauce the first time. It was fantastic and then had the pepperoni and Italian sausage the next time. They do not skimp on the ingredients and the workers were very friendly and provided fast turnaround on the food. This WILL be a nationwide chain if someone decides to go that route.
This place was amazing. They staff really makes you feel like part of their family. The food tasted so fresh and delicious. I'll definately stop by again before heading home.

WOW! This place is absolutely amazing. Hidden away in "The Underground", you can access this little gem by going down the escalators on your left before you exit the lobby of the MGM. If you still can't find it (for those like myself who are directionally challenged) ask any casino worker to point you to The Underground and you'll find it right away.

Each pizza is approximately 10" in diameter, which is pretty darn good for a personal pie. They have a ton of great ingredients to choose from, and they can make it however you like. Want to do half and half? Sure! How about quarters? You might get some dirty looks from me if I was working there and you asked me that, but they will do it for you.

If you're a little overwhelmed with all of your options, they do have preset pizzas you can request and always customize.

I ordered the #5 and added tomatoes to one half, and the #6 + prosciutto to the other. I also requested tomato sauce for the whole pie. All I can say is I wish I could have gone more often.

All of this for $12?? I'm sold!

This is such a great Pizza place.  You build your own pizza,  just like the name, a project.  All the toppings are fresh and delicious.  It is in the food  court area of the MGM so maybe hard to find.  You have to go into the hotel casino.  But it will be worth it.  I think the pizza singles were like $10 dollars.  I love the seating.  So compfy.  A+ for project pizza.

Was going to give them 4 or 5 stars, but noticed, after it was too late, that wife could have ordered the build-your own (BYO) pizza versus the Signature Pizza.  Wife was very specific with her order and would have added veggies knowing there would be no extra cost.  She also thought the $10 was for the SP and that the BYO cost more at $12.  She was just trying to save the family some $.

Yes, mea culpa, but as typical Vegas, you're in a hurry and not always aware of the process to order when it's your first time.  The staff could have helped her understand how to order what she wanted.

I'm sure it's not uncommon when places get busy where food service staff just moves you along versus understanding what you really want.  Prices in Vegas are jacked as it is, so you may as well maximize your enjoyment.

After this, we ended up dining at other places where we were able to get the customizations we wanted.  Maybe others can learn from our experience as there does not appear to be any reason to order an SP when you can get way more on a BYO.

I love Project Pie. I eat there every time I go to Vegas and it's usually my first stop. The pizza is thin, crispy, and full of flavor.
The menu is simple but they happily adapt to your request.

Thin crust pizza my fav. If its yours too, then you must try project pie. Its a little hidden inside the MGM Grand near the check in counter , take the escalators downstairs near the business center. There you will find a little dingy but a slice of pizza heaven, for just above 12$ you'll be able to create a decent thin crust pizza of your liking. And it takes less than 10min. If i didn't have a room booked i would of stayed here instead.

Pizza was delicious! You get unlimited toppings. The sauce had a great flavor too. Soft drinks are way too expensive. It could be cleaner too in terms of the eating area. I still recommend this place though, if only for the delicious pizza and friendly staff.

This place is hidden down in the basement of MGM. It's in between the self-park lot and the lobby.

The first thing I noticed is the restaurant is very Chipotle-ish. There's a pretty simple menu, and everything is the same price. We did a custom pizza, which is also very chipotle. The put the raw dough in a big gadget thing that squooshes? spins? it out into a perfect circle. They put some olive oil on it and asked what kind of sauce, if we wanted, then went down the line telling the guy what toppings we wanted. They threw it in the open oven right behind the service line and our pizza came out shortly after.

Overall I gotta say the Pizza is really good. The crust is nice, thin and crispy, just the way I like it. If you like Deep-dish or thick crust pizza, this is not the place to go. The toppings were all fresh and tasted great as well. We got a Cesar salad for some extra greenage, but it was pretty bleagh. 

Great job on the pizza, and an awesome friendly staff!

A great spot for a fresh pie! I ordered the #2 which was pepperoni, meatball, Italian sausage, mozzarella cheese, with red sauce and garlic. The crust was light and had a good chew to it. The toppings were very flavorful and my overall impression was a good pizza - the only reason it didn't get a 5, is the lack of red sauce on our pizza - I didn't see much of any nor did I taste it. It's reasonably priced (especially in Las Vegas) and a great alternative to eat something different. If you're in the MGM Grand or near, I'd recommend getting some additional steps in and heading to Project Pie!

Great little pizza. Most guys will eat one pizza. The $12 and put what you want is a good deal. The topping are very good and it is fun. We hung out before we went to see a show in the MGM and would go back.

Pizza HEAVEN. Located in the Underground of MGM, it reminds me of a Chipotle where you stand in line and order everything from your tortilla to your salsa. Only here, you choose your pizza, a sauce from heaven disguising itself as an herb sauce poured over the pizza dough, pesto or marinara, and any kind of topping you'd wish for on a pizza. Unlimited toppings for a personal pizza at the price of $12. Your creation gets assembled in front of your eyes and you have delicious, and I mean DELICIOUS pizza within minutes. 

I have a feeling I will be craving this place again and again.
Thin & crispy gluten free crust with unlimited toppings for $12. Tastes good and I only ate half. Worth it!

I'm a Vegas local and this is by far the best pizza I have had in Vegas so far! The build your own for $12 is a great deal. It's thin crust and there are so many options of toppings and cheeses. My taste buds were very happy at the end of my pizza. The girl that made our pizza was also very friendly and seemed happy to be there and not at all annoyed at her job (seems like a lot of people in the customer service or food industry just hate everyone) whenever I am craving pizza again this will be my go to place. I love all the different quotes on the wall as well!
Nothing but good things to say about Project Pie. Pizza is delicious, fresh, and reasonably priced. I consider them to be a gem and make it my first stop in Vegas.

I seriously am IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE.  Only problem?  They are in Las Vegas and I live in Olympia.  I wonder if it is a franchise? maybe I could open one up?  Dreaming........

So I found this place on yelp and am so glad I did.  We were in Vegas for 3 days and with all of the choices we had we ate there twice for lunch.

It is just a cool place hidden downstairs of the MGM.  They feature several standard pizzas and then you can add as many toppings as you want on top of those or make up your own pie altogether. 12 for unlimited toppings and the pizza is a tad bigger than a personal size.  The toppings were so fresh and plentiful. No skimping here.

The staff working there were incredibly nice both times we went.  Very efficient, friendly, and nice.  We enjoyed chatting with them, even if the guy that ran the oven didnt appreciate the Seattle Sounders (wth!!!)

I love the ambiance with the quotes on the wall and comfy lounge seating.

I am afraid my love affair with this place will have to end because otherwise I will spend all of my time dreaming of the next time I go to Vegas to get more Project Pie.

DELICIOUS! I am a pizza snob and I would rate this right up in my top 3 best pizzas ever.
The made to order pizza was hot and fresh! Tons of toppings to choose from! Can't beat the price!

This was a nice surprise. Project Pie is just like the MOD pizzas in the Seattle area. You can add as many toppings as you want on your pizza for one price. 

The crust is thin and nice and crispy. They have tons of toppings you can choose from such as artichokes, basil, cilantro, prosciutto, etc. 

I wish they could make one of these in Seattle. I actually like it much better than MOD pizza. It's a good place if you're looking for a casual and quick place to eat.
Decent wood fried pizza. Cranberry and cilantro as choice of topping added a good flavor.

Came here on a Friday night, right after arriving in Vegas after a long drive.  Walked right up to the front of the line (just beat the crowd) and was able to order my custom pizza. The way this place works is pretty much you can create your own custom pizza from scratch with as many toppings as you like for one flat rate.  They also have multiple sauces you can choose from as well. The people behind the counter were all very nice and willing to help with any questions you had.

Now to the pizza itself.  It tasted great! I ordered the the meat lovers one and added jalapenos.  It is all made on a very thin crust and comes out nice and crispy.  The crust was very tasty (I added a splash of garlic around the sides) and the toppings tasted fresh.  

I would definitely recommend this place to friends and families that are looking for a good and easy pizza place.

Awesome pizza tucked away in the underground at MGM. Friendly staff and relaxed environment. You can choose from a variety of pies off their menu or create your own by selecting unlimited toppings ($12). 

For some context: I dined at the Bacchanal buffet last night at Caesars palace. Sure, Bacchanal offers a variety of more complex dishes, but none of them were truly exemplary. This was a simple, but exemplary, pizza. Great dough with interesting toppings served piping hot out of the oven (as opposed to sitting under a heat lamp for who knows how long). Not to mention for a fraction of the price of dinner at Bacchanal. I'm done with buffets in Vegas (or elsewhere for that matter).

I highly recommend this place.

Delicious. I did the build your own pizza and took advantage of the toppings. It's a small place located among the stores near the self-parking at the MGM. The dough was seasoned and the sauce was pretty good. Considering it's located inside a Vegas hotel-- $12 isn't bad. You may have to wait for a table, if it's busy. Definitely try it!

So good, fresh and hot!! I will probably go there one more time before I go home. Watch out for the couches, they look comfy but are very deceiving. Pizza is awesome though, and it comes out fast!! Mmmm
Cheap, FAST, and amazingly good.  They have pizzas on a menu to choose from or you can build your own.  All for the same price.  Located in the basement of MGM Grand.
Yelpers are right. Wow. Absolutely delicious pizza, really friendly staff, and a Fat Tuesday literally steps away. Such a great find with amazing food. $12 design your own pizza worth every penny.

We stopped by for a quick lunch, only a few people in the place. Had a #2 pizza with bottled water. Pizza only took about 10 minutes and is just the right size for two people if you are not out to stuff yourselves. Ingredients were fresh and the pepperoni was spicy enough but a bit greasy. Highly recommended.

Fun experience to create own pizza! Love their pizza dough machine, works like magic. It is a great place to grab a quality food with affordable price and leave with happy stomach and happy memory. The only drawbacks is it is kinda far away from the center strip. I wish they consider to expand their business, especially outside of Las Vegas.

I was at MGM and decided to grab a bite to eat before the airport.  This new section at MGM has many places, but it's kinda hidden.  We tried #5 which is mozzarella, ricotta, gorgonzola, parmesan, cracked black pepper, olive oil, garlic and fresh chopped basil.  The pizza was thin and crispy and was a personal pan size.  The pizza exceeded my expectations.  The staff was extremely friendly and funny.  I also loved the comfy sofas and quotes on the wall.
Requested my pizza extra toasted!! Lots of veggies that seem very very fresh. Will be back next year Projext Pie :) xoxo
Great spot in the MGM underground!  Good food, prices are reasonable (for the strip) and service is impeccable.  The employees are always pleasant and ready to take your order.
Cool concept and good food! Quick and easy build your own pizza!! Weird location (basement of mgm) but still yummy!!
Perfect, fast, thin crust, affordable pizza with build your own options. Kids loved it and I liked the salad pizza. Great for quick bite and simple with kids.

It's fast food pizza. I LOVE pizza. I love good Philly style pizza. I like to get it by the slice, fold my slice in half and chow down. 

That said, I was a little hesitant to try this place but with 10 people hungry after drinking for 5 hours at Lee's Beer Experience, this is where we ended up. We all ordered our own pies ($12.99 each). Within 5-10 minutes each of our pies made from scratch and at our table. Everyone enjoyed their pies. No complaints on the dinner pizza from anyone. The only disappointment was the Nutella Pizza...YES, Nutella Pizza...not enough Nutella. Our entire group agreed. 

Would I go back? Yes, if I was in the basement of the MGM late night after drinking...absolutely. My favorite pizza place on the strip is Cosmo Pizza (Secret Pizza). YUMMY.

I looked up this place with the hopes to find one of the best pizza places in Vegas. ...And I did !

This pizza joint is very much like a Subway Where you get to add toppings on a very high quality dough. If you don't know what toppings to add just choose a number from their menu - try the original pepperoni nr.2 Its the perfect size, they cook it perfectly and its so good that it doesn't need any sauces etc. Well worth the experience !

Tip:
This place is located inside MGM , near the entry into the casino as you come from the MGM signature parking lot.

I had read the good reviews on Yelp and was in the mood for pizza so I went to the MGM to check it out. Its kind of billed as a do-it-yourself but I don't really consider it that. You basically tell the cook behind the counter what you want on it, he puts it together in front of you, then pops it in the oven. The pizza cooks fairly fast so there isn't a long wait. I was there on a weekday afternoon and the place was nearly empty. My pizza had pretty much every meat on it and was pretty good. If you're looking to fill up you may want to try somewhere else. I would describe their pizza as artisan, light and crispy, not for feeding a big crew type of pizza. I enjoyed it but there are so many pizza places in Vegas one visit is probably enough for me.
So good. I wish we had one of these in Northern California. Good for midnight munchies.

I was disappointed. Not bad and friendly service with a Subway style counter. I've been searching for a place on the level of what I've experienced in the past, which was really exceptional. I thought all of the high ratings here warranted checking it out, but I found the end product mediocre. I would give an A for effort and friendly service.

Right when you enter MGM main lobby, if you take the elevator down, you'll find this pizza place by Fat Tuesday. First the pluses, it's relatively cheap, $12 for the pie, the pizza comes out quick and the crust I'd nice and thin. I usually judge a pizza restaurant by ordering the margarita pizza, which is what I dis at this place. Pizza lacked flavor, imo 5/10. Only reason for 3 stars are the pluses above on top of it.  I will surely mot be eating here again. Waste of calories.
Gourmet pizzas at $12 unlimited toppings. I was amazed how fast they could make the pizza. Nice place for a quick bite before you get back to the blackjack table.

SO GOOD!!! Sausage, Mushrooms and basil... and it came out QUICK!!!
The size is just right for 2 and the price was reasonable for a resort pizza place.

Everyone working on this stop was friendly and helpful. I wanted to hug each of them.

If you are in a hurry, this is an excellent stop.
if you want to sit and people watch, you are in luck as well.

ENJOY!!!!!

What a great place for pizza at a great price.  PIzzas are made to order while you watch, and are ready in only minutes.  Great staff and great food at a reasonable price in the over-priced Las Vegas market.  For $12, the pizza is a good size and has excellent flavor.  Don't miss adding the fresh herbs that are offered, as these are a great touch to any pizza.  Would highly recommend this casual pizza place for a quick bite when in Vegas.

When compared to all different types of pizza and the prices, there are better choices out there. This is good but at $30 for 2 pizzas and one drink it can get a little pricey. The crust is thin so it just depends what type of pizza you like. The idea is cool by assembling your pizza in front of you "Subway style" and allowing you to customize it as they go.

A quick stop and the food is very good. We would have ate lunch and dinner in this place if Vegas did not have so many other options. The staff was excellent and very accommodating.

Visited August 2014

Awesome pie ! Quick and delicious ' they have a very good gluten free pie as well. It's all about good ingredients and a wood burning oven which they have. The crust comes out perfect with a neopolitain crunch and chewiness. Costumer service was in point too. Lots of these places popping around Vegas now . 800 degrees is my fav followed by novento and this place . Would definitely go back!

As indicated by other reviewers, this place is hard to find. First, find the MGM's front desk, then look for signs for "The Underground" (marketing jargon for "basement"). If you need the elevator, go out the glass doors by the Bell desk. Once there, enjoy some great pie. Pretty reasonably priced by Las Vegas standards. Also, once seated, I was glad to be in the basement away from the noise and smells of the casino. It was actually relaxing and I pulled out my laptop and stayed for a spell.

A must if you're at MGM just cruising around. It's on the bottom floor. Pizza was delish and very fresh tasting ingredients. It didn't take long to cook either, maybe 5-7 minutes. We looked for another location in Northern CA, but this chain is still new-ish. Would definitely check it out if they come anywhere near my hometown.
Pizza was superb!! Came together perfectly :) we ordered the meat pizza along w/the white pizza w/prosciutto & Brussels sprouts. They wood fire it on top- yummy!!!
50% discount for military, and a friendly staff. Not to mention the amazing pizza. This was my favorite part about visiting Vegas.

Project Pie is a bit off the beaten path and is well worth the trip. Where else can you get a fresh, tasty customized pizza for a super affordable price? $12. will get you any pie option on the menu or customize your own with unlimited toppings. Yes, UNLIMITED!

Order at the beginning, watch your pie be assembled and placed into the oven. Pay at the register and wait for your name to be called to pick up your master piece. The whole process took 10 minutes. 

The pizza was delicious with a thin crispy crust and generous amount of toppings. It wasn't greasy nor soggy. 

There is a soft drink dispenser and a condiment area with silver ware and to-go boxes for left overs. There is no wait staff everything (besides the pizza baking) is self serve. There are a few tables and a long communal table for dining in.  

A great casual place to grab a quick meal.

Best pizza we'b had in ages. We've already petitioned our home city to open one of these. We ordered red sauce, every vegetable, garlic, Gorgonzola and carmalized onions. And added a kale salad - also good though really teeny weeny.

I'm in love with a pizza...in a T-pain singing voice!!!! Yes I am, at a first glance your like whatever it's just another pie joint with minimal selection and nothing exciting. BUT OH ARE YOU SO WRONG!!! 

Yes folks this place has Pizza and salad and I think that's it but that's all they need. The concept is simple they make thin brick oven pizzas in your face and they do it well. The ingredients are delicious and don't judge the cooks or should I say "Pie Artist" cause they know what they're doing. What I mean is that I was tempted to ask them for extra cheese since it didn't look like much and the people in front of me did so but I didn't and it came out perfect! I got I think it was the number #12 it had meat and more meat, lightly oiled, the perfect amount of cheese and sauce and the flavor of the ingredients were so tasty it makes your taste buds dance. The dough was thin, crispy yet had just enough carbs to hold on to and every bit was amazing. I mean if certain places wants to call them selves a pizza place (not going to mention any names) then they need to come here and take some notes. I totally like it way more then the secret pizza place in The Cosmo but then again their pizzas are good as well totally different but good as well. 

Any how it's located in the hall wall when you enter or exit to or from the parking garage of MGM grand with all the other shops, this place is a sure great place to grab a pie. At $12 bucks a personal size or to share with 2 it is so good a little pricy for the size but worth it. I will def be back just for these pizzas it's easy to get to it has a cool comfy little set up and after you try it once you'll be too addicted not to not come back for more!

Best pizza I ever had. Basically I got a #2 which is sausage, pepperoni, meatball crumbles, cheese, red sauce with minced garlic sprinkled on top. But I also got extra garlic butter on the crust, green peppers, roasted red peppers and cilantro. From time I started to order to getting pizza was less than 10 min. Even the guy working the oven said my pizza looked really good after it was cooked. And he sees hundreds of pizzas a day. Pizza was a good personal size, not overly filling. So tasty. I would not hesitate to eat here again.

Looking for pizza all week and this place was right under my nose!  Basement of MGM on the way out to parking garage. Very quick and you feel like you have found a secret spot. Stopped on way into arena to avoid all the chaos in the District

I'm coming from SoCal where we are having this big custom pizza craze, it was nice to try something similar out in Vegas. I stayed at MGM and this was a great place to grab a bite. I wish it was located in the main food court instead of the Underground where it's kind of hidden away. I feel like they would have more customers being located elsewhere.

The workers are super friendly and love to chat you up. Essentially a full fledge custom pizza place. You can even make a dessert pizza. You customize first, they bake it, and put it in a pizza box with your name. One tip is that, you might not want to load so many toppings even though it seems obvious to do so. The pizza might not cook as well with too many toppings. Price was fairly reasonable as well. Really tasty and a bit less oily compared to your normal pizza hut.
Excellent pizza. Quick service and smiling staff. The guy who made our pizza got fresh tomatoes and clarified that we can take as many toppings as we want.

Love their pizza! Their crust is thin and crispy and you can choose whatever toppings you like. They make pizzas in a fire oven and it takes less than 15 mins. They have a great selection of toppings and for a great price.

I moved to Vegas from DC where they had a great chain of 'do it yourself' pizza places. So when I got here, I was elated to see that they also had one. I was skeptical but I gave it a whirl. 

I was NOT disappointed. The pizza is phenomenal.

I am a weird one in that I don't eat cheese but LOVE pizza. So crust and sauce are huge for me. Both are great here. It truly may be the best pizza there is for someone like me. 

Select your crust (including gluten-free which my wife got and said was exceptional), and add all the toppings you want or don't want before they throw it in the oven for 8 or so minutes. 

I haven't compared it with the competitors in town but no need to because this spot takes care of all of my needs!

Go!
Excellent pizza straight out of the stone oven. Everything including the pizza dough made in front of you and toppings are unlimited.

OMG. I am not a pizza fanatic, but my daughter and I ordered a plain cheese pizza with the feta and other cheeses and olive oil. The crust was thin and crisp, but chewy and tasty. At $10, it was a pizza that filled us both up.
Fresh dough, fresh toppings, reasonable prices and nice servers.
The location was terrible though.

That's all I can say about this place.

so first off, the girl working the front with the tattoos (Caitlyn I think) is super attractive lol. the employees here are personable. anyways, the seating here is pretty unique. low cushions w tables. it's pretty much like Pieology and Blaze Pizza when it comes to food selection. got a personal pizza for $12.97 after tax, pineapples, chicken and pepperoni.
the pizza was delicious. I recommend it if you happen to be inside MGM and have a hankering for pizza lol
Quick pizza.  Not as good a pizza as "800 degrees" outside Monte carlo,  but a fine pizza for a short break.   Younger crowd and workers.  No ambience worth mentioning.

My fave spot everytime I'm in Vegas drunk! The Nutella banana pizza is the best and the prosciutto with caramelizoed onions is my ultimate fave!!! All under $12 for unlimited toppings!! Hidden gem! Now go!

Coming from NYC and the fact that I LOVE pizza, I feel like I am a great one to judge :)

It took us forever to find this place and once we arrived I was glad we had stuck out the search.  The pizza was FANTASTIC!  Since it was my first time in Vegas, I was very disappointed with the food.  Everything was in large quantities and not great quality and very overpriced.

Project Pie was the best food I ate while in Vegas!

Highly recommend!

One of my favorite spots to visit when I come to Vegas. It's extremely casual and the the concept is all open which is great. You can custom order any pizzas you want but they have some already created that are great. They even have a Nutella pizza! It's pretty well priced and the pieces are all personal to the customer. Def a must try of you find yourself in the MGM!!

Super cool pizza place. A little overwhelming to order, because you can literally get whatever you want on your pizza!!!  Extra... Anything!  The guys are super cool and interactive with you while ordering.  Worth seeking out, its in the lower level of the mgm!  Great prices too.
Miss the great pizza and kale salads. Great staff except for gm who is a little bit on the rude side.

This was an amazing find in the MGM and I would certainly be back to get my pizza fix on. 

The location itself is on the way from the parking structure so I can't imagine it gets too busy, but it is a very small area so a big party may not work here. I know for me I got it to go and ate it in the room which did get awkward with drunken stares from people in the elevator.

Foodwise, the pizza is amazing. The dough is thin as I prefer and had a char taste to it that pampered one's palette quite well. I went with one of the pre determined pies and ingredients alone felt fresh and very healthy which is always a plus when dealing with pizza. I really didn't prefer the snappiness of some of the workers, but I don't care how they are as long as the food compensates! 

All in all, well done project indeed MGM!

This is a semi-fast food type of place. Think Subway for Pizza.  It is part of the basement in the MGM Grand. They have pre-set combos or you can build your own pizza. It is a thin crust type of pizza and the dough is fresh! We got the #2 which is basically a meat lovers and customized the other one. Both of them were equally tasty with fresh ingredients and had the perfect crisp. Definitely a great place if you want to save money in Vegas without sacrificing quality.

Project Pie is located in the MGM Grand underground area as you enter from the parking lot. My personal favorite here is their bbq chicken pizza ($12). Their crust is on the thin side and you get to see them cook your own pizza to order too. If my memory serves me right, they serve 12 inch pizzas which is good enough for 1 hungry person or 2 people looking for a quick meal to share. Tastewise, its one of the better pizzas i've tasted in vegas.  The only downside i would say about this place is that they could put much more toppings on their pizzas. I always remember eating here and have at least one of my slices 70% with just cheese. Other than that aspect, the pizzas taste great and their are a lot of options to choose from.

What a hidden gem! Literally, it is hidden because it's located underground below the MGM lobby. "Walk though the lobby, down the escalator, and you'll smell it!" exact words of the MGM Concierge. 

For $12, you get UNLIMITED TOPPINGS on a freshly baked pizza dough. Wooot! Bring it on! 10X veggies, 10X meat, errrythang.

For a healthier option, you can get a kale salad also with UNLIMITED TOPPINGS. It's delicious and very very filling.

Compared to other overpriced BS food in Vegas, Project Pie is awesome. Minus one star because the service is spotty and inefficient; the workers seem to be poorly trained with little care of providing any sort of customer service.

From the main lobby of the MGM grand to the right should be a hall and escalators down to the  "Underground" area of the hotel. 
I wasn't super hungry but it was time for lunch so the boyfriend and I stopped here and by the looks of the pizza I thought I definitely could not finish one by myself. I did and so did the boyfriend and weirdly enough we could probably still eat some more afterwards so this place is more of a snack or light lunch. The food was fresh and delicious! and the service was very friendly and efficient although they were working on a large order! 
Will definitely come back when in Vegas!

Fabulous pizza! I ordered a gluten free pizza and it was great. The guys offered to change their gloves without me asking. Even though it's not entirely gluten free, it was a nice gesture in treating my pizza with care.
Great pizza joint! Pizza is simple but ingredients are delicious. Really awesome service too
Big Bang for the buck! Less than $15 for hot, delicious customized pizza. Love it! Highly recommend if you are staying at MGM.

Friday night looking for Pizza can be  challenge in Las Vegas, not anymore! It has been a long time since a Pizza restaurant delivers flavors that are new and amazing. Down to earth restaurant, you can either do-it-yourself pizza, select anything you want or you can pick #2 in the menu(best ever, recommended by one of the Pizza Baristas :-)
Service is fast, pizza is ready in less than 5 minutes and you will end wondering why pizza has become so complicated elsewhere.

The only thing to be aware off, is that Yelp map location is WRONG! Trust google maps, the restaurant is located at MGM casino, in the lobby that goes to the parking lot. Otherwise you will be driving to a random location nearby Desert Inn.

Pretty good pizza considering your requesting everything that goes on it. I would of given them 5 stars but they dont have anchovies. Been to secret pizza at the cosmopolitan and this was very similar.  I would come back especially if I hear they have anchovies.

Where have you been all of my life? Seriously bro.

In all of about 3 minutes prepare to have your mind blown. You can get a customized, fantabulous, mind blowing, perfect texture chewing, amazing tasting, anything you friggin' want on it pizza made. Everything is fresh! Including the dough! Put all of this together and I think I may have a.) fallen in love all over again, and b.) found my (cue echo voice) favorite pizza place ever!

I love Project Pie and can't wait to go back. They have all sorts of signature pizzas or you can venture on the wildside and build your own. No matter what you order the price is the same. I went with a customized extra cheese, pineapple, sausage, and meatball pizza for my first try. I love that it's made flat bread style (not an actual flat bread, but thin crust), so you're getting a crispy pizza with 100% fresh ingredients made to order. No frozen cheese or processed ingredients here.

Honestly, is $12 a little expensive for a personal pan pizza? Maybe a touch. But let's not forget we're on the Las Vegas Strip where a pizza with far less quality would probably cost twice as much. And this isn't some mini-sized pizza that isn't enough grub for a 3 year old. This is a good sized personal pizza that I struggled to get through. So there is some value here.

The staff worked fast and was very friendly. Definitely didn't feel like I was eating "fast food" even though the order came out quicker than a McDonald's double cheeseburger. 

Do your pizza pallet a favor and make an effort to try this place out!

This unassuming spot in the "underground" part of MGM churns out mighty tasty pizzas. It's good, fast, cheap...such a rarity in Sin City. You can pick from their standard pizzas or create your own for about $12. Each pizza can serve 2 girls or 1 guy. :)
We had a lot of fun picking out out toppings. There was some "oh no! Your mushrooms got on my side. I hate mushrooms!" LOL! They can do half & half on the toppings, but some bits may cross over a little.
Then, the whole thing is fired in an oven.
The crust was thin and tasty, crunchy on the outside & chewy on the inside. We got a chicken BBQ with gorgonzola & added mushrooms. Wow! I was pleased with the blend of flavors - salty, sweet, and savory.
Drinks were kinda pricy at $4 for bottled birch beer (like root beer & cream soda blend) and $3.50 for fountain drinks.
Overall, a great place to stop by if you're in the area & want good, cheap food.
Not impressed. Took forever to find and was basically like a Mod pizza restaurant. And they didn't have any gluten free crust, which is why we sought them out. Disappointed.

Best pizza in Vegas. My favorite pizza place of all time. Build your own is the ONLY way I go. Deliciousness in my mouth EVERYTIME. My pizza is always a mountain of perfection, and I am always treated with great service. Will always keep going to this place as long I have money. =D
Great pizza with alllllll the options!  Everyone in our group ate too much which is always a good thi

You want to put Gorgonzola on a pizza?  I had my doubts, but there it was right on the #6 - a traditional BBQ Chicken pizza with Gorgonzola added.  I figured Project Pie had to know best and I was not disappointed.

In about 5 minutes, my little personal sized pie came out of the "really, really hot" oven and was delivered to me with a smile.  The crust was perfectly crispy, cheese gooily melty, a nice blend of toppings, BBQ sauce just this side of spicy, and the aforementioned Gorgonzola to set the whole thing off.

Project Pie is located in the MGM Grand "Underground."  Take a right as soon as you enter the main lobby and go down the escalator.  Project Pie is just past Fat Tuesday on the right.

There is adequate seating or you can get it to go.  They offer Boylan's gourmet soda (I had the birch beer) made with can sugar.  Service is friendlier even than the showgirls out on the Strip - haha.  Check Project Pie out especially if you are staying at the MGM.

"Gluten-free"? Careful folks. If you are gluten-sensitive or intolerant, this place won't work for you. Their gluten-free crusts share the same oven, utensils, and other materials as their regular crusts. Their only accommodation was swapping out their gloves and cutters. Hopefully they will catch on soon like some of the other venues have (e.g., Blaze, Pieology).

Delicious.. amazing. First time to any project pie. Great. Most thanks to the amazing service by FELICIA. She went above and beyond describing in detail how everything worked a and was  very accommodating to my social needs. Thanks Felicia we'll be back..

Very solid for custom pizzas! Overall, these have quality thin crusts, and the guys at the pizza counter are really chill and nice.

THE WAIT: Not too busy on a Sunday night around 7pm. We basically formed the line You wait a bit for the pizzas, maybe 5-10 minutes.

THE COST: Very reasonable. $12 base price for pizzas. 

THE FOOD: We tried the following pizzas. They are a big heavy compared to a classical thin crust (the cheese is oilier), but they are still tasty, especially coming fresh out of the oven. They are all good, but I didn't *love* any of the flavors. Some of my friends tried the salads and liked those too.

#2: Pepperoni, Italian Sausage, Crumbled Meatballs, Mozzerella on Red Sauce, Garlic. 

#6: Grilled Chicken, Sliced Red Onion, Cilantro, Mozzarella, Gorgonzola, BBQ Sauce.

#7: Prosciutto, Caramelized Onions, Mozzarella, Parmesan (White Pizza).

Great pizza at a great price. It's set up like a subway, you pick a crust (regular or gluten free) then pick your unlimited amount if toppings for $12.99. They have some preset options if you're feeling lazy which are pretty good as well. Get creative with the large variety toppings - the usual suspects but they also have artichokes, olives, pineapples, goat cheese, jalapeños, proscuitto....

It's located in the basement of the MGM called "the underground." Worth checking out if your looking for a quick meal that's a better option than the food court!
This is a great, affordable find in the MGM. Build your own pizza, probably one of my favorites here in Vegas. Thin crust and unlimited toppings. Highly recommend going.

This place, located in the underground of the MGM hotel is in the front near the doors by the lobby. It can be a little bit tricky to find and easily missed otherwise. I passed by the booth several times before it caught my eye. 

The service was great, the guys behind the counter are personable and friendly. The best part? Unlimited toppings!  Its just some solid pie after a night out in Sin City.

This a must for our trips to Vegas. We usually are pretty finicky when it comes to pizza but Project Pie does it right! The thin and crispy crust and fresh ingredients are a contender for our much loved Toppers pizza from Ventura County. The employees are quick, attentive and super nice. We love this place!

Located in the Underground section of the hotel, this might be a little hidden from people who don't know it is there. Headed there for lunch a couple weekends ago and was surprised there was no line at all. Was able to get a pizza made with fresh ingredients of my choice and watch it cooked in front of me in about 10 minutes. Great price for Vegas and tasted very good.
The make your own pie was great. Good pricing, especially considering its Vegas.

Project Pie is located near the self parking garage at MGM. It is create-your-own style, with a couple of salads to choose from as well. As is typical, toppings are unlimited. I wasn't too impressed with the look of the ingredients. Some of the veggies were starting to discolor and they were chopped up pretty small. The sausage and meatballs were small as well. My pizza ended up a little sparse and I do think that $12 is too expensive. You can usually find this style of pizza for under $10 elsewhere. Aside from that, the crust was fantastic. It was thin and crisp and my pizza did end up being tasty. In short, its good if you're nearby but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.
Really nice secret place to eat without the crowds upstairs. We had a group of 9 and had no trouble sitting in this semi-fast food place. Salads were popular with group and no leftovers in site.

Great food, even better service! My husband and I came here for a late lunch while visiting Las Vegas in early February. The pizza was great, the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had half of the #3 and #5 and asked for jalapenos on top. It was the first time my husband had a white pizza and was blown away. The ingredients are fresh and flavorful, the dough is chewy and crisp and baked to perfection. As soon as we were done we went back and got another #5 with jalapenos (hubby doesn't like veggies). It was soooo delicious. And the dessert pie was great, we had the chocolate - peanut butter one and it was like a Reese's cup pizza!

A gem inside MGM! A small place with chairs and tables with a concept similar to Chipotle. There is a standard menu that you can choose from; else build your own pizzas! You have the flexibility to pick your own toppings. All for $12. We picked #5 and #6(BBQ pizza) from the menu. Absolutely LOVED them. The wall at one end of the restaurant has quotes by popular personalities. It was awesome to read these interesting quotes while eating their amazing pizzas. Excellent customer service too.

Good pizza and really friendly and personable staff. Not the best pizza I've ever had, but it was good and I would go back if staying at Grand.  For Vegas a $12 personal pizza is a pretty good deal. The service is set up where you order at the counter and they build your 'za in front of you then you pay and sit down and they bring it out to you when it's done cooking. They don't accept MGM's MLife card so you won't get tier points for your purchase unless you go to the MLife desk with your receipt.  The place is located on the underground level across from the Brad Garrett comedy club.

BEST build-your-own pizza I've ever had. 

Note, this isn't your good ol' thick-crusted hearty pizza - it's more of a thin crusted, quick roasted pizza, but it's nothing short of amazing! 
I've tried Pizza Studio, PizzaRev, Pieology, you name the rest, and I've never understood the hype about build-your-own pizzas... Until I tried Project Pie. 

We got one white pizza (no sauce) with double mozzarella, ricotta, garlic, and basil and one regular pizza with red sauce, mozzarella, tomatoes, roasted red peppers, olives, garlic, and pepperoni. 

Both were AMAZING. Toppings were fresh and plentiful, the cheese was stringy and not too salty, the pizza was brushed with a perfect amount of oil, and the crust, despite how thin it is, was still chewy and doughy enough to satiate my craving for good pizza! 

It's kind of expensive for a small pizza but it's much more satiating than your typical build-your-own pizza places, just because the toppings and dough are so much better! 

The place is kind of hard to find. Basically just follow signs to The Underground (basically, the basement). It's right next to a Fat Tuesday!

Walking thru mgm, heading toward the strip, planning a little walk on boulevard with the family for a little exploring/exercise. The strip is a dangerous place for looky lou's so I keep your head looking forward or you'll be one of those ppl, you know those ppl, vacationers, lol.

Anyway, passed this place on way to strip, looked cool and was in mood for pizza. It wasn't opened yet plus it wasn't lunch yet so we did our thing hit the coca cola store, souvenir shop, the Adidas store, it was fun... Now we are hungry.  

Stopped by rainforest theme place, not interesting, we passed on that. Wife said, I want to take you for bbq, I am always down for bbq, that's my favorite, but in Vegas ok I'm looking at her sideways, like what?

 Then, still walking toward parking lot, seems like we're in the dungeon. I remembered this place on walk out so my wife said she wanted to always take me here cause she knows I like being creative specifically with pizza.

 I Love pizza about as much as bbq anyway so we stopped  and read menu and decided it's not too busy and we can game plan for rest of day while we wait. 

So I ordered, bye the way, it's all personal pizza size so like 7-9 inch round dough. My rule for pizza is 5 toppings only not counting cheese it's a given. Also, tomato on an red sauce pizza, pet peeve, that shit drives me crazy! Anyway, I get mine with roasted Brussels, lil bacon, onion ,green peppers, roasted red peppers and I wanted a lil brine taste but not to much so like 6 black olives and moz and parm to finish it off.  You would think too much right maybe for you but it was the bomb! Hit the spot for pizza that day and haven't wanted any since then. To be truthful today is sat that was last Sat it was really good and sometimes it's hard finding good cheap pizza in Vegas.  

If you want your dollars worth take a stroll thru mgm ask for project pie and make your own or pick off menu. They have a relaxing environment for you to enjoy your pizza and have a birch beer it's a nice throw back beverage! You won't be sorry!

I work a lot of Las Vegas and often take the monorail up and down the strip.  Every time I stop at the MGM, I immediately make my way to Project Pie because I feel that this is the tastiest, freshest and cheapest place you can get some real food on the strip.

Food:  They make all their pizzas fresh and from scratch.  You can choose to order from their pre-set menu, but I prefer to "build my own" pizza.  For under $10 you can choose everything and anything they put on your pizza, which I love.  The hubby usually has them pile on all the meats and cheeses, and I prefer a lighter pizza with veggies and garlic butter.  The pizzas are made right in front of you and taste so delicious with their thin, crispy crust (I'm drooling just thinking about it.)  They also offer a good selection of meats, cheese and topping, as well as a few sauce alternatives.

Price:  Their pre-set pizza items run about $9 - $11 each, and their "build your own" pizzas are about $10.  Great deal for the quality of food you get.  Me and the hubby usually get a pizza each and share a soda, and for about $20 it's a steal.

Atmosphere:  This place is located in the underground shopping are of the MGM.  It's a bit out of the way, so not as much traffic as the casino area of the hotels.  I actually like this because there is always plenty of seating available and there is no smoke smell.

Staff / Service:  The staff here are great!  They are always friendly and great you with a smile.  They make your pizzas exactly how you want it, and they do not hesitate if you have special requests or ask for extra cheese.

This one of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas, and I usually end up eating here at least twice during my trips.  Great prices, tasty food and good service.  A real hidden gem on the strip.  It's too bad this place doesn't get more exposure as I know it would make a killing, but then again I kind of like how it's a little hidden secret at the MGM.

Went back again last night. I told them I was GF and they cleaned out the oven for me! Delicious GF garlic bread, fantasic pizza, and I love their staff. LOVE their staff. Each time we've gone they've been beyond friendly and make us laugh. 

If you want great thin crust, crunchy, fresh tasting pizza complemented by a wonderful stafg, you will love it here!
The pizza was really good and they don't charge for extra toppings when you get a special , the kale salad was ok it was really big I will defiantly go back for the pizza tho

I miss you Project Pie...

Probably the best Pizza I've had outside of New York! I loved how there was a location right under the MGM hotel we were staying at. (Also a Fat Tuesday conveniently nearby too hehe...) For a flat rate of $12, you may customize the sauce and pile on all the toppings you want! (Psst, do get the caramelized onions...they are delicious!) I say this is a pretty darn good deal in Vegas. May we meet again Project Pie!

This is how pizza should be done.  There are several pre-made pies to choose from, or you could strike out on your own and choose your options.  The style here is reminiscent of Chipotle, as you get to watch your dough pressed out (that's a bit weird - how about tossing the dough in the air?), choose your toppings, and watch your fresh pie get baked.  You can't get pie by the slice, but that's ok, because the end result is so yummy that you'll want to eat the entire thing.

Was staying at the mgm signature for the weekend and knew that mgm had a project pie location somewhere in the casino! We were not too impressed with the food court options they had so we ventured looking for some yummy pizza! It was actually pretty difficult to find. It was located one floor below the lobby with only one entrance to the side. The line was long but they pump those pizzas out quickly! Unfortunately this location was more expensive than the San Diego location. Pizzas here are $12 whereas hillcrest was $8/9. Overall it was good and quick and a little greasy. Stars knocked off for the hidden location and the price hike cause it was in a casino.

I wish they have more locations here in Nevada!  I have learn to love custom build your own pizzas. I love how thin and crispy they bake their pizzas here. Really good! I just wish they have other options to their crusts (e.g. whole wheat). Overall, good place for a quick bite in MGM.

Came here twice for quick bites.  The quick service restaurant version of artisanal pizza.  Allows me my weakness for pineapple and artichoke paired with pretty much anything.

Great value on the pies.  Salads etc, less so.

Wether you're up or down on the house, this place is a treat.

The pizzas were fantastic and the staff was very friendly. The pizzas are $12 apiece for a thin crust, 12" pizza. Worth every dollar, unlimited toppings. I got the #2 with pepperoni, sausage, meatballs, and I added bacon for no charge. My gf got the # 5, a white pie, with artichokes, prosciutto, ricotta, basil, mozzeralla, Gorgonzola, parm, and garlic. She said it was the best pizza she every had.
I would highly recommend this place.

If you are from the NY/NJ area where we are spoiled with good pizza, and are in Vegas craving some real pizza, this is the only place that will satisfy your craving. Thin crust artisan pizza made in a Neapolitan style oven, the pizza is made fresh to order in 3-5 minutes. Can't beat that! The create-your-own is an amazing deal with unlimited toppings for one low price. It costs me $16 for a pizza and a soda. The pizza is a personal size - equivalent to 3 regular slices I would say. The environment is very casual and the service was friendly. I will definitely be hitting this place up again!

This pizza parlor is located in the basement of the MGM (the floor they call the Underground). To get there, if you walk into the lobby the escalators on the right will bring you to the right floor. They're located right next to Fat Tuesday.  If you've had Pizza Studio or Build in the Bay area, this has the same concept. You can either do the unlimited toppings or you can pick a specialty pizza if you're indecisive for $12. Love how it's an open kitchen and you can see them pop your pizza into the oven. Takes only about 10-15min for a pizza. When your food is ready, they'll call your name. To make sure no one else grabs the wrong tray, they write your name on the parchment paper of your order (which for some reason really amused me). Long tables, stool seating and low plush couches available for seating.

I love being able to customize my pizzas w/ no topping limits. Ingredients looked fresh and I loved the slight charcoal taste on the crust. Crust wasn't too thick or too thin. The pizza wasn't greasy either.

Most of the staff looked like college students but they were really helpful and friendly. Good place for a quick meal that isn't a fast food chain and not overly crowded. Would definitely be back.

I wouldn't have ever found this place if I hadn't checked it out on Yelp. It is in the MGM underground. If we had found it on our first day there is a good chance we would have just had it for lunch every day were in Vegas! If we had one of these stores in our hometown we would be regulars.
