It was so good and the price was great too! The wait wasn't long either. It also made great leftovers for a late night post casino snack. No matter where we stay next time we come to vegas we will go out of our way to come back here!

Excellent pizza. The crust is very crispy with lots of flavor. The red sauce is very vibrant and they put a good amount of mozzarella cheese on each pizza without it being too thick. Our pizzas were baked very well allowing a delicious char on the crusts.

Project Pie is a great, reasonably priced and fast alternative to the higher end sit down restaurants in the MGM Grand. Sometimes you just want a quick bite that's better quality than fast food but not as pricey or slow as a sit down restaurant. 

It is conveniently located near the lobby and Porte cochere, just down the escalator to the walkway to the monorail. 

I had a sausage and pepperoni pizza and it was very good although just a bit greasy. Less than 10 mins from placing my order tip I got my pizza. The size was about right for a small meal but don't expect to fill a huge appetite here.

I'd definitely return.
Great find. Tucked away in the tunnel under MGM. Neopolitan-style pizza. Tasty ingredents. No alcohol which was my only disappointment. Will be back.

This was the first place we ate when we came to Vegas.  The food is absolutely delicious!  You can't ask for more than all fresh toppings you can eat and gluten free!  The price is reasonable and the personal pizzas are large enough for two people to split.  It's kind of hard to find but worth the search!!

OMG, this is some good pizza!!!

We were staying at the MGM over the weekend of Dec 6th thru 9th (which also happened to be the Rodeo Finals weekend) I had read about this place online while making my reservations for the weekend, but didn't really remember it once we got to Vegas, but we were hungry and it was FREEZING in Vegas this weekend (everyone saying it might snow!!! wtf?!)) so we went downstairs to the shopping/eating area and came across Project Pie and I remembered reading about it.

We decided we'd give it a try, and so glad we did, this was some YUMMY pizza!  There is a menu board or you can create your own.  We went with their BBQ pizza with a few minor changes (Feta instead of Bleu Cheese & no onions) we also ordered the Pizza salad, both were delicious!!!  The crust was perfectly crisp, there were the perfect amount of toppings and the customer service ROCKS here!  I will definitely go back when I am in town and close by ;)

YUM!
Pizza was delicious here!  I highly  recommend coming down from the main floor of the MGM.  The underground  level.  People where pretty friendly here as well.
Nothing that knocks your socks off. Average pizza with an average crust. Probably won't visit again.

Came here twice and each time the pizza was made differently. I ordered the same thing both times. I got a cheese pizza. The first time it was cut in four pieces and the second time it was cut in six. I think it was better when it was cut in four because it made the pizza less droopy. I do understand its a thin crust but I thought that it could be a little more crunchy without burning it. The second pizza was the saad pizza. The first time I got it, it was perfect. The saad was tossed in the vinagerette before it was placed on top of the pizza. That was perfect because every bite had flavor on it. The second time the dressing was on the side and you had to pour it. It made it a very messy pizza with the dressing dripping down my arm. I love thin crust pizza and the cheese pizza was somewhat good but I think it's not worth the drive and the parking to come here.

I went to this pizza place because of the 4.5 star average reviews I saw on Yelp. I'm disappointed to say that I wasn't that impressed. This place was OK. It was extremely slow when I was there. In fact only one other person was there so service was fast. The pizza was decent. It was thin crust. That's about it though.

$12 for a personal pizza, a little expensive, but so good and worth it.
It's like Chipotle for Pizza.

Whenever I am in Vegas, I try to stop by. Located downstairs at the MGM, this place serves good pizza fast. Set up like a Subways, you can order some suggested pies or pick your own toppings. The pizzas come out fast and hot. The crust is thin, not doughy and the sauce is tasty.

Review for 2 people on a Sunday, 5:30p dinner.
- super quick service
- no line at this time of day
- hubs and I shared the #2 (pepperoni, tomato sauce, meatball, etc. like the other Yelpers mentioned)
- nice thin crust

Tips:
- not much red pepper flake jars or Parmesan cheese jars, so please share with other patrons.
- one pizza for $12 is good for 2 people of you're not that hungry.

How to get here:
- upon entering the main MGM entrance, hang a right and go down the escalators
Came here for the first time tonight and the food was delicious! Service was great and everyone was really helpful. My family and I were all very satisfied. I would definitely recommend this place.

It's hard to find affordable food in Vegas where restaurants are super expensive. Project Pie is similar to Mod Pizza. It's one price $12 for as many toppings as you like. I love all the veggies they even have brussel sprouts to put on your pizza. When my pie came out it was so beautiful full of lots of color and looked super appetizing. A little sprinkle of red pepper for spice and this pizza was the envy of the table. Great place - it's in the Underground of the MGM.

I love thin crust pizza.   So light and crispy but packed with flavor.   My favorite was the #3 pizza.   Everyone in the fam. had their favorites.  Ate there more than a few times while staying at the MGM grand. It's tucked back toward the self parking lot.  So it's not quite as busy.  But worth checking out!!

I do about 4 Vegas trips per year and visit this little joint every time. You choose your own crust, sauce, and toppings and it is ready in minuets. It is a perfect eatery for Vegas folks on the go. The ingrediants are fresh and of very high quality, no short cuts, or cheap stuff. and the service is fast and friendly.Perfect for a quick lunch, late nite snack, or take it to go. Very highly recomended.

There are only 2 pizza places that I like.  #1 is Project Pie and #2 is Grimaldis.  I'm a local, but I still like to go here once a week.  You will not be disappointed, and this is how it works:

There is a menu, but you can also choose to build your own pizza.  I always choose to build my own.  

You can choose regular or gluten free.  They grab some dough, put it through a machine that smashes the dough into form, then oil is brushed on the dough, and you can choose whether you want marinara sauce or white sauce.  

Then you can choose your toppings.  Other than mozzarella, there are other choices of cheese as well.  I like to add some blue cheese on mine.  My typical pizza consists of pepperoni, mozzarella, blue cheese, mushrooms, (sometimes prosciutto), garlic, and basil.  

They place it in a wood fired stove.  I love how fresh my pizza tastes each time.

I ate here twice on a recent visit to Las Vegas. I have to say, I think they turn out a really tasty pie and for a reasonable price. If you're looking for an affordable meal in Vegas and you're in the vicinity of the MGM, this is a good bet. Food was great. If the service had matched it, I would have given in 5 stars. But they could use a little work in the friendly and efficient department. That said, I'll probably see them again next time I'm in Vegas and looking for something tasty, reasonably priced, and quick.
Cute place in the underground of the MGM. Made to  .  Order fresh pizza. Inexpensive and tasty. Salad was a joke or I'd give it 5 stars. Kinda like mod pizza...recommend.

Excellent Pizza...... Personal Size equals Personal Delicious at so many levels. The PizzaMaster was awesome and the #2 Rocks!

If in Vegas you have to visit the Underground and have a Project Pizza.

Great little spot in the underground at the MGM Grand. Make your own pizza or choose from one of theirs. Made fresh, takes only about 5 minutes. Staff was super courteous and helpful. We liked it so much we came back the next day.
Reasonable prices compared to other things nearby, and not overly crowded. Find this spot, it's worth it! The food is great and the staff was very friendly.

Decently priced, especially for being inside of MGM. Ingredients are delicious and fresh. I love that there are so many different sauce options and being able to add more of whatever you like (garlic, yum!) is such a treat Unless you're super hungry or going directly back to your room, it's almost easier to find someone to split the pie with. Service is always fast & friendly.

Oh what a delightful delightful place. Its like subway where you can pick your toppings. They fresh pressed the dough in front of us and then added our choosen toppings and threw it in the oven. It cooked really fast and was super yummy. I ate 6 of my 8 pieces at the place and then brought the other 2 back to my room and ate then about an hour later and it was still good. 

It was 27 for 2 pizzas and a soda.

It's a higher end fast food pizza place. You can either pick one of their pizzas or make your own. I picked the pepperoni one. Done in just a few minutes, the pizza was really good. 

It was cheesy and delicious. The crust is thin, and the toppings are fresh. I highly recommend it if you are in the mood for some fast delicious pizza. It is not pizza hut or little Caesar's, it is more expensive and tastes much much better.

OK, so we are here for work. We decided to catch the 9:30 KA show at MGM. So we opted for Pizza. I have to say at first glance not so bad. As the coworkers and I talked about it the next day, we've decided to give it two stars.  When you see 4.5 star average for a review, you expect pretty fantastic pizza. This place was far from knock your socks off pizza. Im sorry but anything 4.5 and 5 average, I've come to trust the Yelp crowds generally as being pretty damn good. 
    First off you stand in line, almost like Chipotle. Not a bad thing, its fast and efficient.  They have a big machine at the head of the assembly process..... It smashes the dough into a perfectly thin, round pizza pie crust. Kind of a bummer in my mind, it takes the mom and pop feel out of the pizza experience. They then take you through the assembly process again just like Chipotle. As you pay for the meal and order your drink, the pizza finished cooking. 
   Im not saying its bad pizza, but to be honest, its hard to F($&# up pizza. If the ingredients decent, and the dough is good quality... its honestly hard to mess up. I guess what Im saying is I expected more. If you are looking for decent pizza quick, this might be the place to go. I probably will not be going back... We do all agree though, that the customer service was absolutely fantastic. Everyone behind the counter was very pleasant and very friendly.

Great place for vegetarians! For 12 bucks you get to either pick a pre made pizza or choose whatever toppings you'd like! Excellent deal for an 11 inch pizza! With so many toppings you can get as much jalapeños or olives you want! The pizza is sliced into four. The crust is thin and slightly crispy! Only takes about 5-10 minutes to be ready too! They also have red crushed pepper and cheese in salt shakers by the napkins. My husband got cream soda for $4 in a bottle. I had a water bottle for $3.50. Everything was great about the food. 
Only things I wasn't too thrilled about was the location. It's in MGM Grand "Underground". Not where I'd place a restaurant that good. It's open late but not 24 hours. Doesn't have much seating options. They have low couches but may be uncomfortable for tall people with long legs. Wasn't a problem for me though! I'm pretty short!

Best pizza ever! It's $12 for any pizza the cheese pizza is $10. Nice simple pricing, easy to order and taste was so good! 
Depending on how many toppings you get, The size is good for 1 if you are super hungry or can split with someone. 
I will definitely be back and bringing my hubby next time! I think I could eat this for every lunch while I'm here!

Probably 1 of  the most amazingly delicious pizzas I have ever had in my entire life....now don't get me wrong, I have tasted alot of pizza but none have tasted so fresh....and I loved the "Subway style" build your own, super fresh pizza experience...I highly recommend....

Looking for a quick late night spot? This place does personal pizzas for $12 with unlimited toppings (you can split between 2 people). They are cooked on a thin dough almost like a tortilla. Which means it cooks quickly and has a nice crispy crunch!

Fresh ingredients, pizza dough is just baked to perfection, every time we are in Vegas it's a go to!! So glad I found this underground pizza place! Boyfriend got the #2 sausage, mozzarella, pepperoni, red sauce, and added mushrooms olives and bbq sauce. I ordered the #6 white pizza no sauce, olive oil, mozzarella, grilled chicken, Gorgonzola,red onion, topped with bbq sauce,added mushrooms and Carmelized onions! Delish!!! They never go wrong:)
Ate here more than once during our stay. Very fresh and tasty. This is artisanal pizza, not your typical greasy pizza parlor fare. Price is right, too.
I eat here all the time and their pizzas are always excellent.  You can basically order whatever toppings u want with a beverage for like $14.  Way wAy better than the other pizza place at mgm

This place is the best and good prices. Very delicious! I first came here a few years ago and stumbled upon it looking for a good margarita and this place lands in my sight. I always come here when I come to Vegas :)
Soooo good, four of us got a few of their specialties, they were all amazing, fast and the service was awesome... would come again in a heartbeat!

C'mon over and choose your pie!

How do you want it? Sauce? White? They can do it all and I am lucky to be able to have this place be so conveniently located there to tempt me everyday.

It is almost like a secret pizza concept because it is located inside of the MGM Grand Hotel & Casino in the Underground. It has a blazing neon sign so you won't miss it as well as its cute layout and decor. I love the mini sofas!

You get in line, pick whether or not you want sauce, move onto stacking as many toppings as you want if you choose the build-your-own pizza option. If not, then there are many options on their menu and you can even get a delicious pizza salad here! It is a personal sized pizza, but I have always split it with a coworker since we are not big eaters.

I have been a customer here since day one that they have opened and the staff has always been cheery and very helpful. One time the bottom of my pizza was burnt and they re-did the whole thing without me needing to say anything about it. Nice service :)

Kudos to Teri W. for sharing the MGM Grand employee discount on here in her review so if any employees don't know.. now you will know! :D

As a tourist, you might be wondering where can you go that is not overpriced and without a waiter service during lunch as you walk down the strip. Yelp to the rescue, saved the tummy. My husband and I were so happy to eat here. They make the best pizza ever. No matter which choice you go with, you will not be disappointed. I got "#3 TOMATO, ARTICHOKE, RED ONION, PESTO, FETA, MOZZARELLA" which was good for my belly and my husband raved about "#7 PROSCIUTTO, CARAMELIZED ONIONS, MOZZARELLA, PARMESAN." Please do stop by "underground" and enjoy the pizza that is not overpriced and delish!

I only recently discovered the make-your-own pizza concept at home, and was happy to see it in Vegas. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and the food was great. 

I ordered a #5 (olive oil, mozzarella, ricotta, gorgonzola, Parmesan, black pepper, garlic, fresh basil), and added caramelized onions. I LOVED the onions--sweet and added so much flavor. 

$12 for a personal pizza (if you're a person with a large-ish appetite) is a bit steep, but not surprising for Vegas. 

I wish they were open a bit later.

During my late June stay at the MGM, I had a craving for pizza and found out about this place.  It is as good as they say and the customized toppings set up makes things even better.  Plus, you get to watch your pie prepared from start to finish, it's like watching the folk at the car wash, you feel involved with the process....... ok, that was a reach. 

Anyhoo - they have standard selections or you can do a total custom pizza. The location is out of the way and makes you feel kinda cool to 'discover' it - very friendly staff.

To make my own custom vegan pizza was awesome! So many different topping for them to pile on ... I asked for all the veggies-- from caramelized onions to walnuts to jalapeños--- and it was amazing--- I added a pic-- so check it out for yourself--- yummO!.... Oh, and the service was great!

My first ever restaurant review; the pizza is that good!  The crust is thin and about 12 inches in diameter.  It is a canvas for the pizza artist in you.  Crazy good deal at $12 to build your own pie with as many, or as few, ingredients as you'd like.  28 ingredient options.  Go crazy.  Or not.  Your call.  You can also go with one of their signature pies for $10 - they have 8 to choose from.  Just wish they also served beer.  But they don't.  So slake your thirst with some soda (free refills) or bottles of juice, root beer, etc.  To sum it up, Project Pie serves up tasty thin crust pizza with your choice of toppings for a reasonable price.
Reminds me of Chipotle, but pizza version.  lol Build your own pizza.  Cool pizza place that opens late.
3.5 stars. Fairly good pizza. Excellent service.

Hard to find location, in the basement but worth the look. Great for a pie especially as a midnight snack. The pies are reasonable priced (as far as strip food goes).  Cool staff, seem to work hard to push the pies through and seem to give a shit in general. Good selection of toppings.
Great service and overall great experience. Build your own pizza and then cooked in a brick oven. Highly recommend.
Perfect place to go after a long night. It's like Subway but pizza steez! Oh yeah, free refill!!

A hidden gem.

This place is at the foot of an escalator, just off the hotel lobby.  It should be part ot what you do when arriving around noon and when your room isn't ready.  Here's the whole process:

1)  Wait in the long line to check in.  There's no way around that wait unless you are a celebrity or other kind of important person.

2)  If your room isn't ready, take your luggage OUTSIDE and give it to a bellman.  That way you avoid another long line to have your bags held.

3)  Hop on the escalator to the "Underground", got to Project Pie, and enjoy what may well be your best meal value during your stay in Vegas.

Way too salty. I asked for half #6 and half #4 with mushrooms on #4. I reminded them 3 times. They forgot it. I also ordered a side caesar salad which they also forgot. I had to tell them that I ordered it. It's definitely not the 4.5 stars that its listed for. The girl making the salad was also in a pissy mood when they asked her to make my salad that they had forgotten. Even the employee handing my pizza was talking to the other employee asking why she was pissed.
Not bad. I would not say great though. Being a bit of a pizza snob, I was disappointed to see that they use canned jalapeños instead of fresh. The toppings were  somewhat light on the pizza too.
Pretty damn good I must say. Worth the prices and they carry birch beer, an east coast classic, that's hard to find in California.

Crave-a-licious!
I love Project Pie Pizza. The thinner crusted pizza is cooked in a blazing hot fire oven. 
Regular Dough or Gluten free. Red sauce or garlic or combo of both.
Create your own pizza with as many topping as you like or pick one of their creations. Add pesto or bar-b-que sauce drizzled on your pizza after it is done. Make a combo with a drink. Eat it with your hands or with a fork and knife. Reasonably priced for the Strip. Take it to go or eat there. Located in the Underground of the MGM. 
You will be saying "Yum!! Yum!!!". Project Pie rocks for delicious Pizza! Check it out!

If Chipotle were a pizza place...

By no means my favorite of places to eat in Vegas, but it was sort of cheap (not compared to Chipotle), tasty, quick, easy, and convenient.

The pizza was tasty, the flavors fresh, the staff friendly, and all was easy. I think I would have preferred it to be less than the $10 price point, but I guess it's kind of like a Las Vegas thing to spend a little more just because. 

Would I go back again? I'm not sure. Would I like it if I did? Yes.

Omg such yummy crust and I usually don't eat crust. Try the Carmelized onion with Parmesan. The best. Plus it is so affordable. I suggest getting your own. My husband gets his own plus I usually find a piece or bite missing from mine.

Great bite to grab before a show. My wife and I had dinner reservations somewhere else after criss angel and this was a perfect pizza snack for us to split. If you're really hungry I'd recommend getting one for yourself.

I ordered two different pizzas and one came out great and perfect while the other came out burned all around the edges and slightly burned on the bottom.  I didn't think it was a problem but because the pizzas are thin when I took a bite it was more burned then I originally thought.   I would have asked to make a new one but I didn't eat it until I had already took it with me back to my room.

This is the subway of pizza places. You go to the glass and order your pizza just like you would your sub. Let me tell you what this place is good for;

1. You've had too much to drink and you are walking out to the car (taxi) and realize the only thing in your neighborhood is McDonald's so you better eat now. 

2. You  enjoy frozen pizzas and don't know any better (this pizza tasted like a frozen California Pizza Kitchen pizza)

3. Cheap. $12.99 for a pie

I asked for ranch dressing, he offers me Caeser. Really? The coke machine needs some help. It tasted like pure syrup. Would I eat here again? Probably if I was in the same predicament. But not if I'm sober.

Sooooooo I love pizza that's no secret, but this place is the best kept secret EVER...do yourself a huge favor & go grab 1 or even 2 of these delicious pies and make your tummy smile. Inside the MGM :-)

My ooooooh my.....I AM COMPLETELY amazed  out how freaking delicious this dayumm pizza was! I,  like many others I'm sure am a pizza lover. I have had many great pizzas. And this just got bumped up to my number 1 spot! Yup I said number one. The 3 reasons why are as follows....

1. You can build your own . With many options to choose from. Canadian bacon, pepperoni, ham, sausage, every kind of vegetable you can think of, a delicious garlic butter sauce for the dough and of course some cheeses.
2. It is only 12 dollars! Wait, what?
3. I got my pizza in 10 minutes!

The pizza was flavorful, fast, cheap, and easy! Service was awesome and the employee's were so friendly! Love how ordering is fool proof and so fast! Definitely a great place for both kids and adults. I'll Be Back... .....in my best Arnold Schwarzenegger voice!

I'm giving  the staff 4 stars because of friendly service  . Great idea for a pizza, like subway, make your own pizza in 10 minutes. The sauce was lacking flavor.  Some people might like it if you add extra cheese.  For the price, its good for a hangover.. you might be so hungry you won't notice..

Wow!  What is not to like here!?!?  You can build your own pie or select one of their inventions.  You can have it with red sauce, garlic sauce, pesto...  You can have it anyway you want to.  This is a must stop if on the area!  My wife is wondering why we don't have these where we live.

You may order it like at Novecento but it doesn't quite turn out the same.  You walk up to them and they'll put the toppings you want, as you choose them, on your pie dough.  Boom, takes a bit to get to you too though.

And the tables were all occupied and the only seats remaining were the really low ones.  What?  

But the pies here were alright.  They're downstairs of the MGM pathway to the parking garage.  They have preset combo's up but you can build your own and I built my own.  I made a meatlovers, the pepperoni looks and tasted cheap.

After picking up our show tickets at MGM, we stumbled across Project Pie on the way to Earl of Sandwich and decided it's too far of a walk for 4 starving people after a 5-hour drive. I'm so glad we came here and tried something new instead :) 

The girls working were really nice and patient with my indecisiveness and I really appreciate that lol
The build-your-own pizzas are only $12, and they also let us do half and half so we could share, which is a major plus cuz I can never finish a whole pizza on my own. At first I didn't really pay attention to the price, then I realized how cheap this meal was compared to other places in Vegas! Haha anyway, for my half, I put grilled chicken + caramelized onions + EXTRA EXTRA mushrooms and it turned out amazing!!! I like how they don't limit the amount or how many items you want to put on your pizza, and the thin crust is just the way I like it!
In the end, all four of our creations (2 pizzas) came out really really yummy! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/project-pie-las-vegas?select=QYr0j_Uvsgo8yNzSLjnR3g#8PQUGKdjVUBA1vtdTqVmxA
I'd definitely return the next time I come back to Vegas :)
not that good...my husband and i recieved coupons for free dessert pizzas and they were burnt on the bottom and just dry.
Absolutely love this place! We've eaten here every MGM stay... Already twice this visit. The staff is always friendly and the pizza is delicious.

Think of this as a chipotle but for Pizza.

For $12 you can build your own pizza with unlimited toppings. I always go with the garlic pizza with meat balls and pepperoni. It comes out smoking hot and fresh and crispy. It's not as great as Secret Pizza but it is definitely cheaper than Secret Pizza.

This is a great stop if you're hungry and you're at the MGM. The wait for a pizza isn't too bad and within 15 minutes you have a hot pizza straight out from the oven to devour.

Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!

Yum, just yum. We were in the mood for pizza and this definitely satisfied the craving. I like thin crust, so if you're a pan pizza lover this is not the place for you. They have any topping you could ever want and the different combinations you can make are almost endless. This place is located in "The Underground" section of the MGM and the line was not bad at all, but it would move fast even if it was.

My buds and I stumbled (literally) upon this cool find inside the MGM Grand. The three of us were all very happy with our personal pies. Very unique thin crust and cheap for the strip @ 12 bucks. Great find.

The pizza here was pretty good and decent priced. You get unlimited toppings and it only took about 5-7 mins before you get your own hot pizza. The pizza is like the size of a medium domino's pizza pie. It is highly recommended to make your own pizza or share it with someone who has the same taste as you :).

I am officially a pizza convert. 
And I don't even like pizza!!!

It took us quite a while to find project pie. Tip- go straight to the back of the MGM, and down one floor to the "underground"- it will be on the right. Better yet, there's a side entrance to the MGM that puts you right next to the escalator going down to project pie. 

I got a gluten free pizza with just about everything on it. Seriously. There was hardly any topping they DIDNT put on it. I wanted it all! Prices are the same regardless of how many toppings you add, which I love. We paid $12.97 a pizza including tax. A steal, in my opinion!

The gluten free crust is DELICIOUS!! Crispy and chewy in just the right proportions, and delicious even cold. 

The crust was brushed with garlic butter, which made it extra flavorful. Each pizza is hand fired in front of you while you wait. The pizzas are super filling, too- I could hardly make it through half the pizza that night for dinner, even though I was starving when we had arrived after walking all the way down the strip from Caesar's palace to find the place, and ate another quarter for breakfast and the last quarter for lunch. It lasted me three meals!!!

The pizza was amazing. The service was good. I would go back here in a flash. 

Be sure to get a mozzarella-ricotta combo as far as cheese goes, and extra prosciutto on top!! The prosciutto gets nice and crispy in the oven, and is amazing!!!

I LOVE the fact they have gluten free options!!!!! Thank you project pie for not making me feel like such an outcast when I go out to eat! I can finally eat pizza along with the rest of the group !!!

My count of visits customized personal pizza places now stands at 4. As I've mentioned before, Pieology is still hilariously absent from this list.

I've passed by Project Pie several times before while walking from MGM Grand's parking garage to the casino proper, but it's always been at inopportune times. When they announced a buy one, get one free special for Pi Day (3/14), I decided that this was a great chance to try them.

This is now a chain like all the others, but the Las Vegas store is the original site of Project Pie. It was launched in 2012 by the guy behind Pieology and MOD Pizza. Like those chains, you can pick from pre-defined topping combinations, or you can build your own 11" pizza for the same price ($12, an unfortunate Las Vegas Strip markup).

I built my own pizza, as always. I started with a red sauce (it was a little light on that, to be honest), added ricotta and feta to the standard mozzarella, loaded up on proteins (pepperoni, bacon, canadian bacon, grilled chicken, spicy sausage), and piled on the vegetables that seemed appealing (caramelized onions, red onion, artichokes, mushrooms, tomato slices, garlic, basil). Unfortunately, due to lack of written labels and underfilled topping receptacles, I missed out on some interesting ones that I saw later on the serving paper (roasted red pepper, garlic butter).

The crust stood out that most to me. It's delicious and it's not super-thin. It's not that crunchy, but I love that it's chewy while not being soggy at all. They did a great job pulling it out of the 600-degree oven at the right time. The meats are all fine, and most of the add-ons do a decent job (tomato slices might have diluted other flavors), but there weren't that many pops of flavor until I added chili pepper flakes. I think that topping is actually better here than at most pizzerias, but there seemed to be a disturbing lack of shakers even at a lull. Good luck finding it if they're busy.

Project Pie is about as good as the other chains in its genre, so I encourage fans of Chipotle-style pizza or visitors to MGM Grand to give it a try. Personally, I doubt I'll be back very often. The regular price, the inconvenient location (although I did happen to get lucky on parking on an early Monday evening), and the relative lack of real standout ingredients all stand in the way.

This place is yummy!!! Real simple concept - pick your toppings, and done! The folks working here were really friendly and the pizza came out fast. Thin & tasty crust. Flavorful toppings. I will have to go again before I leave MGM. It's located in the "Underground" of the MGM resort. If you enter from self-parking, you'll probably walk past it. Give them a try. I got red sauce, garlic butter, mozzarella, pepperoni, meatball, sausage, mushrooms, caramelized onions, ricotta, basil, and parmesan. It was SO good!! And I shared my pizza, so for $12 it was a really good deal, cause I was full!

FYI... One of the employees mentioned they just got bought out by Pieology.

I built my own unlimited toppings pizza for $12. It was delicious! At the counter, you order and customize your pizza. Then they stick it in the oven, and it's ready in a few minutes! I loved the variety of toppings they had. They even had interesting ones like raisins and brussel sprouts. The crust was not too thick and slightly crispy, which I liked. I shared a pizza with my sister, and we were able to split it in two so I got the toppings I wanted on my half, and she got hers on her half. I think we were all very happy. =]

Yummy, their pizza was delicious. Went here before we went to our Brad Garrett show. Its thin crust and you can build your own pizza with whatever you want. The people working here were also super nice and they explained how it worked for building the pizza and also came to clean off a table we wanted to sit at. We got hair pepperoni half cheese with mushrooms. I enjoy it. Also it was fun reading all of the quotes on the wall. I will for sure being going there again whenever I'm at the Mgm Grand and hungry. Yum yum!

Best pizza I've ever had!!! It was so delicious that we ate there 3 times in 5 days!!! Located in the Underground of the MGM Grand next to Fat Tuesday! Price was reasonable and the staff was friendly every time we stopped in!!!! You have to try this pizza!!!

There aren't too many seats here so we decided to order and bring the pizzas up to our room.  We ordered the second pizza on the menu and a pizza salad. The pizza was delicious. Thin crust, not too much cheese and although the topping were a bit salty, they were tasty. The pizza salad however was confusing. It was lettuce and chicken breast on top of pizza dough. There was balsamic dressing that came with it so I poured it on too. Next time I'll stick to just the pizzas.

Found this place by accident, but it was a happy tummy accident.

The decor is trendy and clean, the sofa looks very comfy ( maybe that's the other reason for us to dine there after long day of walking.)

Menu is simple, it was listed on the wall you can either by Number for some popular pie choices, or you can go with $12 to create your own pizza with unlimited toppings.

It is just like a Subway line, you will see the staff make the dough ( the machine will flat the dough) then you can pick all the fresh ingredients to add to the pie.The cook will put the pie to the open fire oven, about 5 minutes later, the pie is ready to eat.

We  were looking for a afternoon snack and this was just perfect, fresh made pie, the portion is good for 2 people to share. we also add a Cesar sale for $5; as I was craving for some crisp veggie after huge meals in the trip.

A good place to take a break from the Strip and slot machines, while you are there, check out the interesting quotes on the wall.

Staff were very friendly, they came to tables and talk to all the guests. So we learned this restaurant is only 6 weeks old, but they are already looking to expand to different states in the coming year. Hope there will be one in S.CA soon.
So delicious!  I love to make my own or order one of the fabulous Pizzas off of the menu!  Fun atmosphere and great service!  A fun place to go with friends and family.

Fresh hot pizza in the MGM underground which is near the hotel lobby. 

Crust was a solid 8/10

Toppings were an average 6/10

Cheese was an average 6/10

Temp was hot and cooking was spot on, I'd go back again.

We happened upon this wonderful place while attending a show at the MGM Grand. The service was superb and the pizza perfect. We were able to choose the exact toppings from a large selection of fresh ingredients. We were amazed how quickly the made to order pie was ready. The ovens are 800 degrees, the crust thin, and it inspired us to return and experiment more. I hope to find a Project Pie opening near my hometown soon! The night we visited, they were open until 2am.

Similar to pieology and pizza studio!

Dropped by here for a quick bite before heading to the M&M world and leaving Vegas.  The place is by the entrance of MGM parking lot, so it is easy to get to. The set up is very similar to Pieology and Pizza Studio.  You can either pick the pizza that they have already designed or you can custom make them by picking the toppings of your choice.  The pizza was good but I didn't see what was so unique about them.  Mainly because I had already had tried other places similar to this place.  They are definitely in accessible to people stay at MGM hotel and other people who park in that parking lot passing through!

This place is genius! I absolutely love coming here for my monthly craving for Hawaiian pizza. Staff is always welcoming and a pleasure to order from. The atmosphere is great. I would def recommend stoping by here if ever visiting the MGM Grand.

So this was my first time here and I was walking to the parking garage to drive to my favorite place (Joe's Pizza) and I looked up project pie on yelp, saw the 4.5 stars and immediately stopped to give it a go.

Positives:
-Freshly baked, fast, friendly service.  (Loved andre, he was courteous and very funny)
-They make each pie just the way you want and doesn't take more then 5 minutes.

Negatives:
-All thin crust pizza
-Line can get long, but moves fairly quickly
-Pies aren't filling for 2, but definitely for one.


Menu:
All cheese pizza is $10
Build your own $12
Pizza and some fresh salads.

And some other goodies but I don't quite remember it all.  

Definitely worth a go.

I came here while at MGM while looking for a place to eat. It's similar to most DIY/customized pizza places. I got #5, but I didn't see much of a difference between all the flavors. The choices are just a base and then you add whatever toppings as well. My pizza came out to $12.97, which I found quite pricey compared to others like Pieology, 800 Degrees and Blaze It. But I guess that's Vegas. 

The pizza itself tasted good, but nothing extraordinary. If you like a thin, crispy crust then you'll enjoy it here.

Mmm.. build your own pizza. 
I've gone to a few places like this... the build your own personal pizza trend seems to be sweeping the nation. It's such a fun concept... and I like to customize anything... So on my last trip to Vegas, I made a stop here for a quick dinner. I was staying at Planet Hollywood and MGM is only a few blocks away, so I trek'd over there... and it was well worth it! 
Great pizza, good quality toppings and a great price point. You get to pick and customize your pie with whatever you like for $12. How cool is that? I'm a meat lover, so I loaded mine up with pretty much every meat option. A few minutes later, they had my pizza hot out of the fire and served up to me on a platter.  I was one happy camper. Surprisingly, it was one of my favorite meals in Vegas... can't wait to go back again next time. 

Directions: Go in thru MGM, down the escalator and it's on your right. You'll smell the pizzzzaaa!

Project pie!!!! Sounds like some new technological age of some sort! This pizza place here is like a goldmine in Las Vegas! Man if I stayed at mgm grand I'd probably just be at project pie breakfast, lunch, and dinner! OK maybe not breakfast or dinner... but you know what I mean! 

It's a nice small sized pizza place using the stone over for that perfection.. I mean pizza. I sadly don't remember what I ordered but I believe it was one of the top selling ones. Although any of the pizzas coming out of here I'll gladly eat anytime!! 

The experience overall here is wonderful. Great staff and service and little waiting time. Also got a nice selection of drinks in the fridge. The size is like a medium roughly. I'm sad it doesn't come in x large but that will suffice! 

Will definitely be back here to get more!

Came here on a friday night because I was starving and wanted to find a fast place and I chose the right one. The staff is very helpful, the pizzas are decent sized and very tasty. They have a couple of their own creations but you can fully design your own and they are all 12 bucks which is a bargain seeing as if you are not that hungry, you can easily share
After our second visit, Project Pie has proved to be consistently delicious and affordable. If you are near the MGM Grand stop by for a visit. You will not be disappointed.
Looked at Yelp  reviews and it was all true, Pizza was great. We got a number 2 and number 6 (personal size pizza). Great taste and toasty !!! Will come again

By the time I got to Vegas I was starving (I don't eat plane food. Ick.) this place was quick, cheap and hit the spot. I got the #7, white pie with prosciutto and caramelizes onions. My total was $13 or something absurd like that. Seriously, it's cheap. I enjoy thin crust pizza, and this has freshness and temperature going for it. Not sure how it would handle reheating but whatever, I was hungry and ate the whole thing.
Find this place and if you are Gluten Free or avoid Wheat this place has great Pizza! Not for Celiac's but the rest of us... Run there!

Great pies whether you're sober or drunk which is why we came here twice in our 3 day visit!
Don't miss the fact that you can create your own, I missed that on our first visit. We stopped in here because we were in MGM to get the tram, had a craving for some pizza and the place was pretty hopping so we thought it would be a good call. And it was! The first time we ordered a #7, it was tasty and came out fresh, /made/cooked right when we ordered it. Second time we built our own, which seemed like a better value since the wife and I both chose more toppings than what was pre-selected on the menu. It is not a wood fired oven but it still does a great job of cooking up some good pies.
The staff were friendly and the prices were on par with being located in a casino. The convenience factor is what brought us in the first visit, the good food is what brought us back on the second. 
If you want some good tasting, convenient pizza, then this is your stop!

Excellent service is what stands out to me for Project Pie. Friendly staff and a commitment to customer satisfaction - more than the pizza itself - is what makes this place a gem. Don't get me wrong, the pizza is pretty good, but the service is top notch. Case in point - I ordered a $12 build-your-own pie yesterday for lunch. When it arrived at my table, the manager came over and apologized that it got slightly burned around the edges. I said it was no big deal, and he informed me that they were replicating my pie - that's right, an entire second one - for FREE for me to take. How could I say no?! 

With the build-your-own-option, you can literally put whatever you like on your 'za. The roasted red peppers and artichoke hearts are definitely winners. I removed pretty much all the chicken from my pie(s), though, because it was a little questionable and not so tasty. Not sure I would go for any of the other meat toppings, actually. But sticking to the cheeses and veggies is not a bad idea! Good food and service for the money.

Why not try all of them?

I love me some wood fired pizza and I love a good value.  For $12 you can get a pizza with whatever you want on it.  One pizza will sate a hearty appetite.  

Of the toppings I loved the prosciutto and the caramelized onions.  Why don't more places put that on a pizza.  Such a great sweet flavor that just complements whatever else you put on.  Yes, you can put all the meats on there, but don't get carried away as too much can make it salty.  

I would like a little more crust, but for the speed they crank it out and the value I don't care.  Where else can you satisfy your hunger on the strip for that little.

This was one of the best finds during my trip to Vegas. $12 for a personal pizza with unlimited toppings and GF crust with no up charge, yes please.

I was so happy that they asked me prior to me telling them about my allergy to gluten just by asking for the GF crust.They even made it a point to switch pizza cutters and try to eliminate as much cross contamination as possible. This in my book goes a long way. On my next trip, I will definitely make it a point to stop here for a quick and cheap  lunch.

Wow... I've been curious about the whole "create your own pizza in front of you" concept for awhile, and this was not only neat to see, it was definitely great pizza.  

Ordered up a pretty non-traditional BBQ chicken pizza, and watched as they pulled out the dough, pressed it in a machine, topped it off generously, and then finally sent it to the gas-oven to get cooked.  The final 12-inch pie that came out was super thin with a slight limp on the crust near the center, and crisp on the very outer edge.  

Flavorful, fast, and quite fresh, I have to say this is some great pizza!  While some articles have the owner maketing this as "neapolitan like", I'd have to disagree and say that this is pretty far from a traditional neapolitan style pizza...

But that doesn't make it bad.... to the contrary, the pizza is delicious from crust to toppings.  If only I had more free time in Vegas, I would've come back for a few more meals.

Verdict:  If you're looking for a purist Neapolitan pie, this isn't it.  But if you want some delicious pizza that's fast, fresh, and flavorful, you've found your place.  It's a shame a gem like this is hidden in the lower levels of MGM.  I hope your business goes well and I look forward to coming back for more pizzas!
This pizza was absolutely delicious. Possibly one of the best places you can find on the strip. They have a variety of toppings, friendly staff & provide fast service.

Who doesn't love Project Pie?! If you're staying at MGM Grand, a local, or someone who just wants to enjoy a quick delicious pizza, Project Pie is a must try.

The pizza here is thin crust and personal sized. I could share mine on a normal day but if I'm starving, I can eat the whole pizza. You can build your own or order off the pizza menu. The ordering style here is like Subway, the worker makes your pizza right in front of you. I love the number 2; pepperoni, Italian sausage, meatballs, mozzarella cheese, marinara sauce, topped with garlic. I add in mushrooms and olives to make the ultimate Italian pizza. 

They have a ridiculous amount of toppings available ranging from ham, chicken, to caramelized onion and artichoke. You can make a Pizza Pie! My only advice is to ask for your pizza well done if you pile on a lot of toppings. Gotta make sure that doughs fully cooked underneath that pile...

For healthier options you can get a pizza salad too. They bake the dough for you and you can load it with fresh greens, veggies, and meat of your choice. I don't personally want to eat a healthy pizza but I have a few friends who've ordered and enjoyed the pizza salad. 

The service here you cannot beat. The workers actually look like they enjoy working and are all very friendly. Delicious thin crust pizza with excellent customer service! Kudos Project Pie.
This place is a must if u love pizza. Made to order pizza in less than 5 min. Amazing toppings and great friendly service

Holy cow!!! Yes yes yes! There are not enough stars to give this place! My boyfriend and I were craving pizza but nothing too heavy and found this amazing place on yelp. Our pizza was customized just the way we wanted and came out hot and delicious! Totally reminded us of a chipotle but with yummy pizza! I wish we found this sooner or had more time in Vegas so we could go back! Thankfully there is always next time! When you are in Vegas and want some delicious pizza if you go to this place you will not be disappointed!

The last few trips that I've had made to Vegas I have had very bad luck with making food decisions on the fly. When I came across Project Pie and found out they had 4 1/2 star rating on Yelp I was both excited and skeptical at the same time.  For the first time ever in Vegas I made food decision on the fly and it worked out. My boyfriend and I ordered a white pizza and cheese pizza and both pies were delicious. Our pies were out of the the oven and on out table in less than 10 mins. I would definitely order one Pie per person. I was also pleasantly surprised when my total came to $23.

If you're looking for a quick meal that is reasonably priced Project Pie is your spot.

My favorite place in Vegas!! This gem is located at the MGM Grand in the underground. Best service, food was great and fast. This place is really amazing. I wish we had them in Texas. If you are in Vegas, please give this place a chance you will not be disappointed! Best pizza I've ever had! Thank you project pie!

Hidden gem located downstairs from valet parking at MGM. Two of us built our own pizzas and the other two chose from their menu. All the pies were delicious and the perfect size for one person. Fast service and cool quotes on the wall. The perfect last meal to end our Vegas weekend.

I think this place has the nicest staff in all of Las Vegas. Did they import everyone from the midwest? Because we were greeted, asked about our day, asked what we liked, etc. etc. The pizza was pretty darn good too. We had the white-pie with pesto. It cooked quickly, all while the staff was very engaging. I had NO idea this place existed until I found it here on yelp. If you are looking for a great late-night eat, this is your place. It looks a little sketchy as you take the escalator down stairs off the lobby, but keep going-you're almost there.

I love this place.

An affordable and fresh bite on the Strip, let alone in the MGM Grand? Yeah, it exists. Project Pie never seems to be busy they make fresh pizza for just $12. You pick the toppings, they throw them on your pie and then bake it in the oven. 

If you've been to 800 Degrees you'll know what to expect here, though the choices here are significantly fewer, but the taste is still there.

My only desire is that they'd add a beef only meatball option to their array but I can live without it, ooh, and it would be great if they stayed open until the wee hours of the morning, but that's what Wolfgang Puck's MGM Grand restaurant is for.

Active duty Military get a discount!  I wanted to say that first because if you're scanning through reviews that little money saving nugget might be buried at the bottom where someone won't see it unless they read my entire review.   I think police and firefighters do too, but I digress.  This was an amazing spot, I can't believe it wasn't packed when I went in.  You have to hunt for this place, but it is seriously good grub.  I had the white pizza with chicken, prosciutto, roasted garlic, and sautéed onions... just dynamite eats.  All it needed was some sun dried tomatoes and it would've been near perfect. I will absolutely becoming back for more!

I happened to walk passed this place in a low-traffic area of MGM and the concept seemed appealing so I decided to check it out. The counter workers were very friendly and helpful and provided excellent service. I wanted to order healthy, so I opted for the ricotta cheese with grilled chicken, mushrooms, olive oil, and pesto sauce. I was able to choose as we went down the line (same way you would order a sub at Subway), so I watched my pizza be created step by step. The beauty of this process is that you can adjust portions of toppings and add however many! After it was put in the oven, it was ready in a matter of minutes and delivered to me at a table. The pizza is a tad difficult to eat... flimsy, thin crust; however, a fork and knife go a long way! Overall, I'd say it's a charming little build-your-own pizza joint :).
Amazing thin pizza. It was sooooo good and the staff was friendly.  It's in the MGM Grand and made a good stop before we left Vegas. I'm coming back again.

The best! A little confusing finding for the first time if you don't ask.
Options: awesome
Time: perfect
Service: the best
Friendly, quick, easy and cheap.
Loved the style and the quotes on the wall

Would love to see more of these on the strip.

Went here a couple of times during my stay in Vegas. This place is basically the Chipotle of pizza as they let you put as many toppings on the pizza as you would like.

I went with the red sauce and mozzarella cheese both times and added ham, proscuitto, and pepperoni, along with a myriad of other vegetables.]

The service here was very friendly and the meal prep and cook time was speedy as well.

Overall, this is one of my favorite places to eat in usually over-priced Vegas and comes it at just under $13 per pie.

They messed up one of our pizzas and were sooooo nice about it!! everything tasted incredible and they were able to accommodate all our crazy food restrictions! (Gf, dairy free.. They have vegan cheese) Alex was so nice!!!!
$12 for a customized pie! It was fresh and delicious!! The Cesar kale salad was also good. Service was friendly and efficient. Would definitely return here!

Oh mah crusty thin heavens! Despite the fact that we were already Seriously Full from eating our way down the Strip, we listened to Yelpers and other articles listing Project Pie as a dayum nice slice. 

Loosened the belt buckles another notch and ordered an impossibly thin, perfectly crispy pie and did not regret a single bite. 

This is not classic pizza, per se, it is a light flatbread brushed with olive oil and decorated with your wide choice of toppings with the spiraled sauce and cheese. Its size would be an appropriate individual pie, as it is not a heavy, greasy, filling type of pizza. You cannot go in expecting "typical" pizza. Go here because you want to try something exceptionally atypical. 

The Underground location is quirky and chic with its industrial stools and low-set tables. Fast and friendly staff with a furiously great pizza pie. 

Not only is Project Pie a hidden gem, but it's a gem you can eat.

Such an awesome place in the Underground of MGM. They have an already made menu but you can also add any toppings ($10 to $12). The crust is light, crunchy and just amazing. The pizza maker knows just how much to add. Staff were friendly and place is clean.

The build your own pizza option is pricey at $12, however, the pizza was really good. 

They are not set up to accept MLife card comps so that was a pain but hopefully that will get worked out soon. 

It's definitely worth a sit down & try though.

DIY foods are pretty popular with people on the go (think Chipotle or Subway), with Project Pie being in the DIY pizza category.  It's a decent dining choice if you're at the MGM and want a quick, casual meal.  Pies are $12, and you can either choose from pizzas with pre-determined toppings, or go crazy and customize it with your own topping choices (yes, you can order a pizza with everything on it).  These are personal size pizzas, so don't order one and expect to be sharing it if you have any semblance of an appetite.

I had one of their own creations, the number 5, a white pizza with mozzarella, ricotta, gorgonzola, parmesan, cracked black pepper, olive oil, garlic and fresh chopped basil.  Toppings were placed all the way to the edge, so there wasn't really a crust to speak of.  The pizza was decent, not the best white pizza I've had, but not a bad deal either taking location and price into consideration.

If you are in the MGM Grand, you MUST come here and to Michael Mina's Pub 1842. The pizzas here are not only fresh, but extremely affordable. For under $15 you can add as MANY toppings as you want to your pizza. 

They serve fresh made to order personal pizzas that are just the perfect size to fill you up (one pizza may actually fill up two people!)

The staff is friendly and explains everything very well. My tip to you is while you are waiting for your pizza to finish baking, go across the hall and grab yourself a stella to pair with it! ;)

This place is in the walkway from the parking garage into the main lobby of MGM Grand. The place is pretty hip. It has a modern diner feel. Quotes are printed along the walls. They have super low couches. I'm 5'2 and Inhit my knee on the table a few times while waiting.  I Came here after Lady Gaga's concert with some friends. We called to see what time they closed and it about 10 minutes. Since the pizza's are designed by the consumer, we had to be there to place the order, so we ran downstairs and made it just in time. The run there was definitely worth it. We got there and they were totally cool, no one had a snotty attitude that we were there just as they were about to close. They had great service. They explained how everything worked. 

There's a little menu on the window for you to choose from or you can build your own pizza. You can get a personal cheese pizza for $10 or you can get whatever you want on your pizza for $12. They have a spread which is a like a butter sauce, so if you don't want red sauce, you have another option. The toppings include different cheeses, italian sausage, chicken, red peppers, yellow peppers, artichokes, Gorgonzola, , mushrooms, bell peppers, pineapple, black olives, pesto, garlic and more.  I got half cheese with green bell peppers and pineapple, which tasted really good. The other half was bbq chicken which was not mine, but was tasty to my friend. The pizza is made thin and has crispy edges, which is something I love when I eat pizza. The crunch is not too much but just right. I'm so glad we got to eat here. Now I know where to go whenever I go back to MGM.

Project pie is a welcome relief to the overpriced and often underwhelming food located around the casinos.  We got two pizzas - both very tasty and, relative to what's around them, reasonably priced.  The only negative was everyone, including the workers, grabbing the hot pepper flakes and parmesan containers full palmed by the top - eww - lots of germ spread there.  Ask for packets of pepper flakes and parmesan as they keep both behind the counter.

This has to be one of the best pizza joints in Las Vegas!! On our way to the concert we needed to get some food and as we walked by this spot we just had to stop. The smell of the pizza wouldn't let me walk any further. They make it just right and you watch them every step of the way! For how expensive it is to get a decent meal with good customer service on the strip this spot is a must do! The price is unbeatable and the taste will keep you coming back for more.
Delicious pizza. Friendly staff. I always get the #2 and add bacon. All meat pizza. A great meal before a night out.

PIZZA? Yes please!

Grabbed a quick pie after the comedy show and I wish we would've bought two they were so good!

They were pretty busy but the two guys kept up relatively well. 

Opted for the #7 that was a white pizza with prosciutto - I'm sold. The guy suggested to add bacon too. Sold again. Bonus, there wasn't any extra charge for added toppings. 

Thank goodness another patron noticed the pizzas were switched as mine was being boxed up (because mine was boxed I didn't see what it looked like). We would've wound up with "Mike's" pizza but his still smelled damn good!

At the time in the evening we ordered (10:45pm) they didn't have any of their dessert pizzas left - bummer. Swung by Corner Cakes on the way to our room instead.

Very good thin crust pizza downstairs in the MGM.  Build your own pizza with many toppings or order from a set of choices, for $12.  A very hot oven cooks the pies rapidly, so there is very little wait, we will return.
Holy crap this place rocks!!! Tom hooked up his own creation of mozzarella chicken blue cheese bacon sausage jalapeños tomato sauce and BBQ sauce and it was a 10! Definitely recommend.
Oven-baked, personal, customized pizzas. Hits the spot if your looking for a quick bit.

Great concept, basically as much toppings you want for $12.

The pizza is the perfect size for 1 person too. The crust is nice and thin. So you can easily finish this by yourself without feeling guilty of eating all those calories.

I was glad to hear that there is another branch in Hillcrest, San Diego. So I will definitely stopping by that restaurant as well.

Again, the pizza is good. Good quality, and choose your toppings or just go for their standard menu, all for $12 per pizza.

This was probably the cheapest meal we had our whole vacation. We got a daiquiri at the Fat Tuesday's next door then headed over. My husband, as usual got the basic neapolitan style pizza-just cheese and sauce. I got a "white pizza" (no sauce) with caramelized onions, mushrooms, roasted red pepper slices, garlic, prosciutto, and gorgonzola cheese. It was delic! the only strange thing was that my tongue felt slightly numb after eating it, chris said the same thing when he had a taste...so I did not finish my whole pie.
We chose the #2 and the #6 and they both were awesome! The customer service was great! Employees were friendly and interactive!

Delicious!!!!!! Best pizza we had in Vegas. Wayyy better then Secret pizza or the places at NYNY. Project Pie is fresh, easy, quick, and I love how custom it is. I ordered the BBQ chicken and added pineapple. It was crisp, held its shape great, good crust and the pineapple was huge a fresh. Great individual size too. Staff was very friendly and knowledgable especially the two gals working. Would totally go back!

Make your own pizza seems to be the new craze sweeping the food world. This place is a good but not great edition.

First off the staff is a little off, they all appear to be young, teens or early 20's and kind of going through the motions. They appeared to be having more fun gossiping and goofing off than helping customers.

They do have a variety of toppings and you can pretty much add whatever you want if you pick the create your own pie option. For the price I would advise the create your own and not any of their specialty pies.

Place is a little tricky to find as it is in the underground beneath the MGM. Decent option if you want a quick bite for in Vegas is a sort of reasonable price.

This is an interesting place.  It's sort of like Chipotle or Qdoba, but with pizza.  They have about 10 or so pizzas you can order, and you can add toppings as you please.  Or, you can just create your own.  A personal pie that's about 12 inches was $12.  And, it creates 4 substantial slices.  It's a good-sized meal.  Also, they are thin, so baked very quickly, which was nice.  They have a pretty good system for moving people through the line.

I had the BBQ chicken pizza and a slice of the "meat lovers" pizza.  I put that in quotes because I can't remember the name of it, but it was the pizza with a bunch of different meats on it.  I highly recommend both.  The BBQ comes with a large amount of chicken and BBQ sauce.  The sauce is slightly sweet with a good tang.  I added jalapenos which were perfect.  The meat lovers was equally good.  I like Project's red sauce, it had more flavor than some pizza sauces.  Also, they do not skimp on the toppings.  If you are at MGM Grand and need a quick bite, you can do a lot worse than Project Pie, and I don't know that you can do a whole lot better.  Highly recommended.

Stayed at MGM for 4 days and ate this every single day, no joke. It's open pretty late so you can feed that late night craving. Even the workers recognized us since we kept coming back day after day. Best pizza ever...addictingly good and at a nice price too.  All the toppings you want for $12, crispy delish crust, and surprisingly not greasy. Can't wait to come back; my new favorite pizza joint
I've eaten a lot of pizza in my lifetime... This is the freakin best I've had!! Create your own and be amazed with your own creation!!...whatever it may be...

To be quite honest, I was a little skeptical wanting to like this place since it being located downstairs in the Underground inside the MGM Grand. If you've been there, it's just an area you would kind of ignore walking from the parking garage to the lobby of the casino but anyway, let's talk PIZZA.

It's not an actual restaurant or cafe. It's, well, FAST FOOD. But let me add, FRESH fast food. The concept is simple. Either you can order from their pre-fixed menu or be that creative master chef that you are and customize your own personal sized pizza with unlimited toppings for $12! Yes I repeat, UNLIMITED TOPPINGS FOR $12. And good toppings at that! (browse the pictures to see what I'm talking about)

I love thin crust pizzas and not all places can balance out the thin crust texture along with the heavy toppings well but Project Pie does it right every time. I'm a cold pizza lover as well so it's also a good idea to place it to the side for a while and enjoy it at room temperature so the crust can soak up all the butter and oils for some more added flavor. YUM.

I work inside the MGM Grand and they're known for some high rated restaurants such as Joel Robuchon, Craftsteak and the recently added Hakkasan so grabbing something to eat on your break can be a bit pricey. Came here super hungry and unexpectedly found myself hating my thought of assuming that this place would be horrible. That only teaches me to never judge a book by its cover (as cliche as it sounds) and give every place a shot before placing judgement on it. And while you're at it, say hi to Andre for me and tell him that Julie from Hakkasan sent ya! He'll make your pizza with love which will make it taste even better.

I was walking into the MGM with my family, and BAM! - we came across Project Pie.  It's discretel hidden as you walk into the casino from the parking lot, in an area with random shops that do not seem to get much foot traffic.  If you have ever eaten at a Blaze Pizza, the concept is the same, build your own pie.  

You can either create a pizza with your desired topping, or go with one of their recommended combinations.  I followed the recommendation of Kyle F (Yelp reviewer), the #5 - Mozzarella, Ricotta, Gorgonzola, Parmesan, Cracked Black Pepper, Olive Oil, Garlic, and fresh chopped Basil (white Pizza), but with no additions, it was delicious!  

The style is a nice thin/crisp crust pizza with great flavor.  We got 2 personal pies to feed the family, and it was enough for lunch, for dinner we might have gone with 3.  They also have speciality sodas you can buy, or get a cup and use their soda machine.  

The actual location is great to sit and eat, no table service, you order from the counter and then sit at your desired spot.
Delicious pizza. Super this and crispy crust. The toppings were crispy and tasty.  We will stop by here many more times!

Everything about Project Pie was a positive experience. The crust reminded me of California Pizza Kitchen more than a NY-style. I liked seeing them make the custom pizzas to order; we enjoyed our pizzas (meat lovers and white), and our dessert pizza, the "Black and White". The fact that they have Coca-Cola is awesome; that's harder to find on an MGM property than a single-zero roulette wheel! I do worry that the line could get long very quick with the abundant options slowing folks down, but we were there off-peak hours.

It's a 4.5 star place, but I rounded down because faced with a choice we would return to Secret Pizza (at Cosmopolitan) over this. If it wasn't Las Vegas which has abundant delicious options, would be a definite 5.

Next time you're in Vegas and hankering for a hearty meal - definitely drop by Project Pie.  I was here a few months ago over EDC weekend - it was exhausting and I was in dire need of some nutrition.  After some searching, my friends and I stumbled into Project Pie and I couldn't have been happier! I got the BBQ Chicken pizza - it came with red onion, cilantro, Gorgonzola and mozzarella cheese; SO good!  And beyond the fact it's great pizza, it's also an affordably filling meal which in my opinion can be so hard to find in Vegas!

yay, my 100th review!   Glad I'm writing a positive review for Project Pie in the MGM Grand.  Their pizzas are one of the best deals on the strip! For 12$ you get to build your own pizza with unlimited toppings and its ready in less then 5 minutes.  Awesome. I ate there twice.  The pizzas are all one size, thin crust, i was able to share with friend and still was full, but if i was really hungry i could have inhaled the entire pizza myself.   They have your standard toppings and also some more less common toppings like roasted bell peppers, Gorgonzola cheese, and dates.  I thought their toppings were high  quality.  The only complaint that I had was that both times the pizza could have come out a lot hotter.  I think because I piled on a ton of toppings  it didn't get heated thru all the way in there brick oven.  I'm sure I could have brought it to their attention and they would have heated up for me, but it really wasn't that bad , it still tasted super good.  The staff at project pie were all very cheerful and attentive. Its located on the lower level between self park and escalators up to the lobby. Odd location so they don't get that busy.  I'm sure if location was more  central they would be full house all the time.  but nice, modern, hip vibe.  I will definitely be back!

Angela T said it best when she said this place is the "Subway of pizza places." That's not necessarily a bad thing.  

First, the location isn't the best.  It's in the downstairs walkway on the way to the parking garage, so it's a bit of a walk from the rooms and the opposite direction of the pool.  However, if you're on your way from the garage, this is a great place to grab a quick meal.

The pizza was good.  Really good. Great? No way, but for what this place is, it does the trick. The crust was just ok for me.  The dough is placed on a dough press and bam, it's time to pick toppings.  We got a cheese (kids, of course) and a #7  (white pizza with caramelized onions, proscuitto, mozzarella) and they were both very good.  Each pizza came with 8 slices, or maybe 6, but at any rate, 1 pizza was good for 2 kids, so yes, it's personal sized for adults.  

$12 a piece, it was a deal compared to anything else at the MGM Grand.  Even McDonald's and Nathan's in the food court had comparable prices, and those meals will make you sick.  

The employees were really nice.  Friendly, funny, and efficient.  

Yeah, it's worth a visit.

Walked by Project Pie every weekend for almost a year without stopping in as I walked from the garage to the casino or back at MGM. Granted, some nights it was closed by the time I wanted it. Anyway.. I finally stopped in the other day and didn't know what to expect. I briefly read the menu and saw that I could create my own personal pie for $12. I know what you're thinking... $12 for a personal pie is a rip off. It was my first thought too before I remembered that I was standing in the MGM Grand on the strip at just after 12am. Then I found out that included in that $12 was as many toppings as I wanted... say what?!?! It's the Subway/Chipotle of pizza!

Now I'm really skeptical as that seems almost too good a deal. Staff was very friendly and I ordered one of my favorite combinations... meatball, pepperoni and ricotta. Ordered with a little extra sauce and a little less mozzarella. I took it to go and it was gone by the time I got home.

Really enjoyed this pie.. by no means is it best pizza I've had but it was tasty, you get it hot right out the oven, it cooks in about 3 minutes and you can put whatever you want on it.

I'll probably stop in more often going forward. Maybe I'll try one of their pre-set combinations.... or maybe I'll just have them dump all the meatballs on my pizza and pig out! Queue evil laugh...

Fresh ingredients. FAST service, not rushed. Friendly staff. It looks a bit dead, you almost think its closed if no one is dining. The crust is thin and amazing. I got the 7, prosciutto Parmesan mozzarella caramelized onions, I added their awesome roasted peppers and basil. Great pie, not cheap, but not too expensive. Do it.

Go get a beer or drink now!! Why cuz they don't serve it here. That's why fool. They have a little bar next door. Grab something there if u need. Look this place is the chipotle of pizza. Walk the assembly line and pick what u want and how much. 12$ a pop. Good size. Get one to urself.  Finally u and your lady can agree cuz you'll each have your own. And hey man when ur in Vegas stop looking at the hott chicks in skirts. Ur lady totally knows ur doing that and she understands but make her fell good. Ok??? Thanks. Service is good and the pizza is bomb. I'm not one of those yelpers that just has to show u I've been to every part of the world and here's my pic of me in NY. here's my pic in Japan. I don't need to brag like those annoying cres. What's a cre u ask? Well learn spanish or ask  a Latino. It's short for credio or creida. In other words those annoying peeps that act all uppity and like they are so hott and know everything. Anyways I'm rambling. Get here eat and enjoy life. And stop kiss ur lady and tell her u love her. She loves the unexpected shit like that. Just don't look at the skirts until after u done that. Love u baby cakes.

A pizza place where the price is the same no matter how many toppings you choose to put on it.  They have premade options to choose from or you can make your own.   The crust is thin but not cracker thin.  All of the toppings are fresh and they make your pizza like they make subs at some sub shops.  It starts with the crust and sauce then it is moved down to the toppings and cheeses and then into the oven.  Took about 15 minutes from start to finish and I had pizza left over to snack on the next day.

YUMMMY. Ahh yes. Pizza makes me so happy especially when done very well. Got the cheese pizza after watching a show at MGM. It's located conveniently near the underground walkway to the east parking garage. 

The pizza had the perfect ratio between cheese and sauce. It was oven baked with a thin crust crunchiness to it. I was amazing by how quickly they were able to make it ! They have a variety of soda including unsweetened ice tea. The booths with coaches for seats were super comfy. The wallpaper had interesting quotes on it that kept me entertained . I definitely would return again and would recommend it.

The Subway of pizza, and I mean that in a good way. I went here for the gluten-free pizza. They did warn it's probably not advisable for serious Celiac's. I had no issues. You select one of their pizza ideas or build your own. You choose the sauce, then cheeses and all other toppings, as they add each one to your pie. They throw it in a super hot brick oven, and it's cooked by time you finish paying. Love the concept, and I devoured mine before I could bother taking a picture.

Place is awesome. Tremendous flavor in the build your own. Light and thin crust olive oil and tasty sauce. Really works well lots of fresh toppings and it all just comes together perfectly.  Hard to find but tasty as hell.

How does this place only have 24 reviews?? This place is good! They make the pizzas right in front of you! Dough... tomato sauce... topping fresh Mozzarella cheese, and any other toppings you want! I love that it's fresh! Bonus points to the employees that gave us a free pizza. Turns out someone didn't want their pizza, so we took it instead! I will say that I will eat their Signature Red Sauce Mozzarella Pepperoni and more pizza!

Absolute majestic hidden gem located in the MGM Underground. 

A pizza with all the toppings you want for only 12$ in Vegas- cant pass it up. They're quick, delicious and the employees are friendly!

For dessert, we ordered a nutella and peanut butter pizza and it was DELICIOUS. it came out nice and warm and the manager sprinkled some cinnamon on top. Its best to be eat right away as it tastes superb extra hot. But don't get me wrong, it's still good after its cooled down. 

Please open one up in the Bay Area!!

Great price and amazing food for being on the strip! It's rare you find a pizza place where you can choose as many toppings as you want especially for $12!!! This is the best pizza shop I have come across so far in vegas. I got a #5 with chicken and extra mozzarella and it was amazing! The gorganzola was a but strong, but it was still delicious.

Similar to the concept at 800 Degrees, where pizzas are cooked under 10 minutes. Unlike 800 Degrees, Project Pie has one prize for certain dough and then you choose however many toppings you want on your pizza!

We all know I am obsessed with the Chipotle style concept.
I've always got a hungry kid and even hungrier husband with me, its fast, fresh and cheap (more  money for shopping!)
Seeing as the Vegas Strip is overloaded with 5 star dining options I didn't even know where to start planning where to have dinner.
Well, turns out in the MGM we were STARVING, behold Project Pie.
$12 for a pizza any way you want it, usually around $8 at Pieology, Blaze and others, but it's Vegas, I'll take it.
Nutella dessert pizzas, tempting at $6...
Side salads at $5, large dinner ones at $12.
I asked if I could make my own, as their options all had chicken which I don't eat.
So I used pretty much all the veggie topppings from the pizzas and made a huge, amazing salad.
Split a pizza with my son, half veggie, half meat, my husband two pizzas with the works.
3 pizzas and a salad came to $55, not bad for a great dinner on the strip.
Ready in about 5 minutes, great service, clean place, come here if you spend all your money elsewhere!

Underrated doesn't even accurately describe how amazing this place was. They go out of their way to ensure you get the most for your pizza and it's cooked and seasoned to perfection. I'd even say it's a step above the pizzas I've gotten in Italy. I'll be back again!

I love the atmosphere. We just felt like a quick bite and didn't want to go through the whole "sit down" restaurant experience. The pizza is really good and fulfilled our needs at the moment. I like that they don't have way too many options as well. In my opinion, the more choices, the less greatness... I would definitely recommend this place. Again, great food, great ambiance, and courteous staff. Thank you!

I have absolutely no idea why this disgusting place has 4 1/2 stars. First of all, horrendous service. Sorry you work at a pizza place? I guess? I mean it wouldn't kill you to smile and to the red head that took my order,  I could definitely do without the passive aggressive attitude. Second, don't give me a pizza i paid almost 20+ dollars for that literally has burnt-cancer Brussels sprouts, so black, they were practically indistinguishable. Then, when I politely return my pizza, justifiably so, you give me a bad attitude and then GIVE ME MY PIZZA BACK WITH COMPLETELY RAW FREAKING BRUSSELS SPROUTS. You clearly put them on after the pizza cooked. HA! okay, I see what you did there. It's asinine. This place is gross and needs to go.

This is such a fun place to eat! For around $12 you can pretty much put anything on your personal pizza. They have a large array of ingredients and are helpful when you try to decide what might be good with what you've picked so far!! They do have menu options if you're not feeling too creative that you can pick from.

For being located in the MGM grand, the amount of pizza was reasonably priced for the large portion as well! We came on saturday evening and it wasn't too busy! Everything was quick and it was the perfect place to stop and eat in between things. I'm glad we decided to stop by! We definitely enjoyed our meal.

Be warned! They have no ranch!!! The owner/manager refuses to carry ranch as "the pizza is good enough for you to not need any." Don't get me wrong, the pizza was great. But... I need my ranch!

I look forward to this place when a Vegas trip is booked and I long for it after I retune home.  The Chipotle of brick oven pizza.
