The dough ball is pressed when you step up to the counter for the ultimate freshness.  The cornmeal crust is the game changer vs other pizzas. Unlimited toppings for $12.99, ask for it crispy and they'll let it cooked for another minute or two.  It could just be the Vegas rush, but this place is one of my favorites!

Been waiting a long time to try project pie. It had been closed a while for remodel. It met all my expectations. Very thin crispy crust, sauce not overly powering the flavor of the toppings. Theres just great balance in flavors.
My only reason for not 5 starts the food to price ratio $12 for a personal pizza seems a bit over priced for the amount of food received even tho it was great tasting. But of course you have to expect it on the strip. 

If you like meat I recommend #2 with carmelised onions and roasted bell peppers. The sweetness from the onions really balanced the tart and spiciness of the meats. 
 
MGM Is a huge casino just look for the underground that's where the place is at right by front hotel check in.

If you are staying at the MGM you must make your way over here. Bring friends and have a pizza party! I love the DIY concept. You can build your own or they have a menu to choose from. You can get colorful and add on tons of veggies and keep it simple. It's not too pricey for Vegas and it's quick and casual. They also have a variety of salads...I had my eye on the kale one for next time. Very friendly folks back there working the woodfire oven! Enjoy your creatively made pizza pie!

Food was great! Quality, price, variety and proportion was right on. We have a few places similar to this in Orange County but the thing that really stood out to me was the customer service. Everyone was so nice to us and they were also very kind to each other which made this an extra pleasant experience. I wish I could remember the name of the girl who helped us to specifically compliment her but it was a LONG week and I'm drawing a blank so great job EVERYONE!

I was referred to this pizza place from a couple of friends. After watching one of the show at MGM we were hungry so this was the perfect opportunity to tell my friends to try this pizza place out. 

I ordered a #2 which was a sausage/pepperoni pizza. The gentleman that was putting the toppings on it was very stingy. He put a little bit of cheese and very light on the sauce. I'm not going into details on the toppings... Let's just say... It felt like I didn't get a piece of topping in every bite. 

First impression when I got my pizza "that's all for $12" it was pretty small. They could have at least added more topping. 

After taking my first bite, I was pretty disappointed. For it being oven cooked, it didn't taste like it. 

Customer service was up to part either. So.... I'm Not a fan of their pizza & this restaurant. I rather go upstairs and eat in the food court.

Pretty sure the staff is loaded on something. The male who made our pizza was super slow and did not make eye contacted cross contaminated meat and veggies and cheese so be aware if you have allergies, etc. there were four staff members and no one but us waiting and the three women stood and watched him assemble the pizzas. The tables were dirty and nothing was stocked even though it was empty. They talked to each other rather than help customers. Unacceptable standards anywhere let alone Las Vegas. Horrible. I know pizza sounds like a great idea but go elsewhere.

Not bad for a quick bite. You can make your own or choose one from the menu.

I ordered a number 6 and a side kale caesar salad. While the pizza was good the salad was overly doused with Parmesan cheeks and the kale was difficult to eat because it was not cut small enough.

$12 pizza with any and all toppings your heart desires.  I highly recommend getting bacon as a topping because bacon makes everything yummy.

The servers are super super friendly, and the pizza is done in a matter of minutes.  Perfect after club grub session.

This little pizza place is in the bottom of MGM close to the gift shops and monorail. We were hungry and didn't want to venture out to the strip so we gave this little gem a try! We ordered two pies which were $12 each. I got the bbq chicken which was delicious! My boyfriend got the one with the sausage and pepperoni. We did not realize when you get up to the toppings bar they are unlimited! Stack up! If i were to do it again I would have done a "create your own pie" and loaded up. These are VERY thin crust pizzas, but filling for a quick cheap lunch. Yummy and fast!
This is amazing Pizza really great flavor friendly staff fast service no long wait either just great amazing pizza here at the MGM you got to try it.

I did not even know this place was there but we walked by on our way into the MGM Grand from the parking lot.  We had a show and decided to do dinner afterwards.  Since we saw the pizza place on the way in, we decided to stop there on the way out for our late dinner.  

The place has about 7 pre-set combination pizzas but you can make your own and even add more toppings to the pre-set combos.  And what is great about it is they only charge one price.  You can have as many toppings as you want and its still the flat rate.  No per topping pricing like most places do.  

I had the # 7- Prosciutto, Caramelized Onions, Mozzarella, Parmesan (White Pizza) - with mushrooms and black olives added.  It was delicious.  Their crust is on the sweeter side and is really tasty.  The crust is super thin so it was not filling like thick pizza can be.  Their oven is super hot so the pizzas cook fast.  

My companion had a pepperoni pizza.  She really liked it.  It was a bit greasy but very tasty.  

If I happen to be at the MGM Grand again, this is definitely a good place to stop for a quick meal.  They have one wall with all kinds of celebrity quotes on it.  Its fun to read while you wait.

The flavor was excellent. Everything felt fresh. We tried the #2, #4 and Hawaiian pizza. All are thin crust and are a little bigger than a personal size. It was cool that they let us do a half and half so we could try a lot. It's very low key and quiet. They don't serve alcohol, but there's a place next door and across from them that both do. I am fan of regular crust, but this is definitely one of the best thin crusted pizza places I have ever been to.

I feel sad for all the other yelp reviewers who said this was the best pizza they ever had.
It is a solid, quick, inexpensive meal choice though. The veggies (namely brussel sprouts and artichokes) were tasty, roasted, and fresh.  But overall, the pizza was bland- the dough and cheese particularly and I found the prosciutto tasted like nothing. 
Although I wasn't too impressed, I would hit again.
The crust is nice and light so I left satisfied but not overwhelmingly full.

SERIOUSLY good pizza prepared by seriously awesome people!! This is everything you want in a neighborhood pizza joint...fresh ingredients prepared in a big brick oven. All the ingredients you want on a $12 pizza...and $3.50 for unlimited sodas. Great dinner and fabulous value!!!

This wonderful little pizza place is located in an area of the MGM Grand known as the "Underground" (previously the Star Lane Shops).  It can be difficult to find, but connects the parking garage to the main hotel lobby.

This is a great place to eat if you are looking for a quick bite to eat before going to Brad Garrett's Comedy Club, also located in the same area.

It's a great concept.  Build your own pizza.  Or you can choose from their predesigned specialties.  Pizzas run around $12, which is a bit pricey, but this is Las Vegas, and they are made with very fresh ingredients in an 800 degree oven, so I believe it is well worth it.

I had the #7, which is mozarella, parmesan, garlic, fresh chopped basil and sliced tomatoes.  It was delicious!  I can't wait to try something else or to be more daring and build my own!

The staff is very friendly and fast, and if you are an employe of the MGM, you can get a pizza and a soda for $9 by showing your employee ID. They have pretty late hours -until 2am most nights, and they seem to keep pretty busy.

All  in all a great place and an excellent addition to the hotel.

Best pizza I ever eaten . The ingredients were fresh . The staff were super friendly and super helpful . I made a chicken ,pineapple ,pesto and garlic pizza . I know it sounds crazy but it was super delicious

We were the first customers of the day, and we ate here on our last day of our Vegas trip.  We have eaten at Pieology, a similar type place in the East Bay.  Our pizza tasted about the same as Pieology, with about the same ingredients.  Pizza was $12, a bit higher than Pieology.  Maybe because it was Vegas?  Place was very small, and atmosphere wasn't as nice as our local Pieology.
Second time eating here and both were fantastic! This will definitely be on my list of places to eat during every Vegas trip in the future
Wow , felt like a pizza , strip offered very little , and in a basement pizza becomes a craft . Amazing

Looking for a delicious meal in Vegas that won't break the bank? Most quick places in the hotel taste blah and are super overpriced. 

Project Pie is a yummy place that you'd find in your local neighborhood. There are 8 pizzas on the menu that you can order by number or make your own. We ordered the number 2: pepperoni, Italian sausage, crumbled meatballs, mozzarella, their signature red sauce, and garlic. We were able to add some items  to our pizza at no charge: artichokes, red onion, green peppers, olives, jalapeños. 

The pizza dough can make or break your pizza experience...the dough here is pressed in front of you when you order and once baked, it is crispy golden, and sparkling with olive oil!! Super yummy!!

Project Pie is located in the "Underground" of the MGM hotel. At the main lobby with the Lion statue, there are a set of escalators that take you to underground restaurants & stores...and Project Pie.

I am a pizza snob, and have tried it all. So, I was surprised that one of the best pizzas that I have ever had, was at Project Pie, which at first look seemed like the Chipotle of pizza.  But, their pizza was great.  At my fault (misunderstanding a menu item) the cook offered to remake a pizza. I told him no, edit the pizza but don't toss it because I misunderstood.  It was great.  I loved the cornmeal crunch of the crust, and If they can do that well with a mistake, I wonder what they can do with a regular order. The best pizza in Vegas is hidden away in the underground of a casino, but find it, and it is amazing.
I am very picky about pizza.  This is awesome freshly made thin crust pizza!  Please open one in Mountains Edge!! I have brought others here and they love it too!

The pizza here is D-LISH! I definitely recommend coming here and building your own. There are lots of ingredients to choose from and it's all nice and fresh. It doesn't take too long for them to make the pies, so if you're short on time. Give this place a try. 

The size of the pizza is about 8-9". I was able to finish it myself. The crust is thin and has a nice crunch - not super crunchy but not soggy. 

I definitely recommend coming here! Enjoy!!

I found this spot on the underground at 
The MGM Grand Las Vegas. The menu is from $10.00-$12.00 average. We can most likely call this a hidden gem. If you want a personal flat pizza, white or red this is the spot. Only 4 stars because the small amount of toppings. It was still delicious!

Love the concept!  This is a quick, choose your topping - ready in 5 minutes and blasted in a 800 degree firebrick pizza oven.  Best of all, the ingredients are all fresh and they taste great!  The heat must help bring the flavors out.  There isn't much variety in the pizza dough, it's all thin crust, but you can choose any toppings you want at no extra cost, and all for $12.  Also like that they have different sauces available as well as the variety of toppings.  It's fast food, similar to subway or chipotle, so they have the system pretty much worked out. 

Location wise, it's in the basement of the MGM Hotel, so unless you're staying there it isn't all that convenient which is a negative, and only open until 11pm, 1am on Fri-Sat.  But if you're staying nearby or at the MGM, it's worth going to.  Service is good, with energetic young college age kids serving the pizza up.  When I went there the first time, the girl accidentally dropped the pizza topside down on the floor after taking it out of the oven and had to start over.  She was apologetic and handled it well, though, but I doubt this happens a lot.  Definitely worth stopping by if you're in the area.

Great great pizza, great value $12 for an individual pie, you must come try this pizza. Don't order from the menu but make your own, you can add all the toppings you want for the same price.... The bread is thin so you won't be full with bread but you will be able to enjoy all the ingredients.
Great for fast eats. I need to generally avoid this type of food but for pizza it didn't make me feel so bad. Definitely fast and catered to exactly what you want with good ingredients.
Good pizza with a nice crust and tasty sauce. A small bummer you can't get any water without paying for a bottle, but that's the way things are moving.

The pizza here is awesome! 

Basically, it's a build your own pizza and it's the best thing ever. 
Portion size is enough for 1-2 people. 

I knocked off a star due to the service. My family and I ordered three pizzas, but they charged us for four because they charged the guy behind us with our order. I honestly don't know why the lady did that because it was VERY obvious that he was not apart of our group for the orders. 

The lady then asked another lady for help to fix the transaction because she had charged 4 pizzas and we ended up paying for 4, so she needed to fix the transaction and payment to 3 pizzas. 

When the other lady came over to help, she asked for the credit card and pretended to press some buttons and "focused" on the screen, then handed the card back and said "It's all fixed!" 

A week later, we checked the card statement and NO ADJUSTMENT WAS MADE! She didn't do shit to fix the transaction.

Tucked away in the MGM Grand underground is a kitschy little pizza shop. Its assembly line so you can watch your pie getting made.  Take advantage of building your own combo of toppings and get something unusual.
Love it!! Food and service were both great! :) you get to make your own pizza && its super fast fun and yummy!

This place advertises that is gluten free with a gluten free crust , just left without actually eating there however, the manager states that, "we recommend that if you have siliac disease or are allergic to gluten not to eat here." She admitted that cross contamination is a certainty . Definitely not what the website suggests!

Major let down!!

Wow I don't even know where to begin with this place. Since I was staying in the MGM Resort and was craving some pizza, Yelp said this spot was popping. As we walked up we were glad to be introduced to the familiar concept of build your own pizza like Pieology. I was super stoked to pick out all of my toppings and what not. They called our order and they said they burned my pizza and they'll remake it. Ok that's fine no problemo. Pizza #2 I get it and it's missing hella toppings....umm seriously? I should have asked for my money back at that point, but I figured 3rd time is always a charm. So pizza #3: they just put the missing toppings on Pizza #2 and put it back in the oven so of course they burn pizza #3... Eff it, I gave up, they couldn't make a pizza right with 3 tries so forget it. The bf's pizza tasted great so I missed out on awesome pizza due to incompetent pizza makers....sad day.

I'd have to say, these kind of places really do depend on how you design your own pizza. It might be a hit or miss depending on what ingredients you choose for your pizza. 

I absolutely LOVED my pizza. But my husband got a bit over excited (you can choose any toppings you want, and the price is all the same!) and put way too many things on his pizza in my opinion. Also the mix of things might not always match. 

Located in the basement of New York, New York hotel. When we got there, there weren't any customers, so we were a bit hesitant. It got great reviews though, so we checked it out. You order fast food Chipotle style, point to what you want in your pizza. Then they stick the whole personal pie into the oven. Thin crust pizza. Got my pizza white (no sauce, just olive oil), started out with a base of toppings that included brussel sprouts, added chicken and a few more toppings. Came out amaaaazing. Didn't think I would finish the whole pie, but it was too good not to finish. The brussel sprouts definitely made the pizza. I was surprised how good they tasted after being baked onto the pizza. My husband agreed and wished he had put them on his pizza as well.

This pizza is FANTASTICALLY FLIPPIN" FABULOUS!!  I love that I can have as many toppings as I like without having to pay extra for each and every one of them.  The garlic butter sauce combined with the tomato sauce is so my favorite pizza sauce ever!!  The dough is perfect, not overly bready and not thin as a cracker.  The vege's are nice and fresh.  It's only minutes before the heavenly pizza can be devoured since they cook so quickly.

Love the kid size sofa's, the quote wall and most of all the Super Friendly service!

LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!

Really good pizza!  Why do I like their pizza?

1.  Thin crust
2.  Great price on the Strip... all of their speciality pizzas are priced at $12.
3.  Perfect size for two people at 11"
4.  I came here both times and ALL of the service staff were uber friendly and served me with Aloha!
5.  Pizza took less than 10 minutes to arrive.
6.  Plentiful toppings and flavor was excelllent.

My gripes?
1.  No alcohol.  Not a big deal as there is a Fat Tuesday in the adjacent shop.
2.  They close too early for me!  I wished they stayed open until 4am or so....

I am starting to like MGM Grand and will probably stay there if not at the Cosmo, and if i do, i expect multiple visits to this pizzeria!

The pizza is legit! Fairly priced too!
Easy to order & it came out fast! Good service. 
Plenty of toppings to choose from to make your pizza what you want it to be. 
If you're really hungry, you can have one to yourself easily. If not, split it.
Would come back again when in town.

The gluten free pizza by far is the best gluten free crust I've ever had . But it is still cooked in the same oven as the normal crust and also the workers don't take any extra precautions to avoid cross contamination like at other pizza places . The customer service sucks . You will be lucky to find a table to sit at that doesn't have crumbs or left over trays on . BUT AT LEASE YOU WILL HAVE GREAT PIZZA . 

Ps: if you want a gluten free pizza crust call ahead of time , reason being is because they only keep a limited stock.

Personalized pizza! Yum!  Definitely a good choice for a semi-fast and affordable meal while enjoying the the grandeur of the MGM.  The pizza is large and fresh, the crust is the perfect chewy:crispy ratio, and the service is friendly!  Cannot complain, especially for a place inside a LV resort :)

This is not a secret pizza joint in the MGM Grand.  But you might totally miss it if you never head down the escalator going towards the self parking garage.  They offer personal size pizzas that you can customize from their list of toppings (plus walnuts and crasins, which are not on their menu) or get one of their pre-conceptualized combos by number.

They do not hand toss or shape the dough by hand.  There is a nearly fool proof dough press that pretty much does that, before they start building your pizza to order.  On my visit, I decided to get EVERYTHING on my pizza.  The pizza took a little longer to bake in their oven, but came out tasting pretty good (bell pepper didn't have enough time to bake and wilt).  For $12 it is a good deal for a restaurant inside a Strip casino.

Besides savory pizzas, they also offer 3 salad options (Classic Caesar, Mixed Greens and Pizza Salad).  ($5 - $12)

For desserts, they can make dessert pizzas too!  Nutella & Berries sounds most enticing. ($4 - $6)

Sodas with free refills.  ($3.50)

If you want relatively inexpensive casual meal while at MGM Grand, this is probably your tastiest option.  While you wait for your pizza to be delivered to your seat, you can entertain yourself with random quotes from Anonymous to JFK.

Service was fast and friendly.  They were generous with the toppings, but next time I will try ordering my pie with ALL OF THEIR Italian Sausage (Anthony M already got dibs on their Pepperoni).

Only negative (looking out for the post-clubbing crowd) is that they close at 11pm.  Way too early in my opinion.

Arguably one of the best pizzas I have ever had (and I'm from Chicago). It's located on the bottom level of MGM grand. Take the escalators down by the check in entrance. 

The crust is perfectly cooked and thin, sauce isn't too tomato-y.... and I would recommend the build your own option. They have a great variety of toppings and for $12 you choose anything from Brussel sprouts to bacon. 

It was a comfortable amount for me and my boyfriend, but you might want your own if you're super hungry. Would totally recommend!!
This place was great.  It was recommended by our neighbor whose brother runs this point.  The value to taste ratio is unmatched anywhere.  I thought the food was excellent!
